args.name:
mode: String - can be one of:
* "Equipment"
* "Item"
* "VehicleWeapon"
* "Weapon" - specific item type, based on BIS_fnc_itemType
* internal use only: "screenshots" - create items one by one and take their screenshot. Works only on "Render" terrain.
* internal use only: "screenshotsTest" - create items one by one without taking screen (to verify everything is ok)
patches: Array of Strings - (Optional, default  inline[]) list of CfgPatches classes. Only weapons belonging to these addons will be used
types: Array of Strings - (Optional, default  inline[])

bis_fnc_exportcfgmagazines.title: BIS_fnc_exportCfgMagazines
bis_fnc_exportcfgmagazines.description: Export list of magazines for Arma 3: Assets.

args.name: classes: Array of Strings - (Optional, default  inline[]) list of CfgPatches classes

bis_fnc_exportcfgpatches.title: BIS_fnc_exportCfgPatches
bis_fnc_exportcfgpatches.description: Export list of addons for Community Wiki - Arma 3: Assets.

args.name: classes: Array of Strings - list of CfgPatches classes

bis_fnc_exportcfghints.title: BIS_fnc_exportCfgHints
bis_fnc_exportcfghints.description: Exports `CfgHints` to wiki format (see :Category:Arma 3: Field Manual).

bis_fnc_importimagelinks.title: BIS_fnc_importImageLinks
bis_fnc_importimagelinks.description:
Imports CfgVehicles image links from Community Wiki (https://community.bistudio.com/).
# Run the script. It will copy a text into clipboard
# Open your Sandbox and paste the text into edit field
# Preview the page (don't save it)
# Copy the resulting text and use it in your scripts

Result is to the following format:

_imagesCfgVehicles = [
	"papercar","https://community.bistudio.com/wikidata/images/8/85/Arma3_CfgVehicles_PaperCar.jpg",
	"firesectortarget","",
	"building","",
	// etc
];

bis_fnc_exportfunctionstowiki.title: BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki
bis_fnc_exportfunctionstowiki.description:
Export function descriptions to Community Wiki. Exported text will be copied to clipboard in XML format.
Wiki Admins can import them using Special:Import.
If the page already exists, it will be replaced only when timestamp is newer.

args.name:
filter: Array - (Optional, default  inline[]) functions filter in format [tags, categories, functions]:
* tags: String or Array of Strings - CfgFunctions tags (e.g., "A3_Oldman"). Use empty string for all of them
* categories: String or Array of Strings - categories (e.g., "Debug"). Use empty string for all of them
* functions: String or Array of Strings - specific function names (e.g., "BIS_fnc_log"). Use empty string for all of them

bis_fnc_effectfiredrifle.title: BIS_fnc_effectFiredRifle
bis_fnc_effectfiredrifle.description: Used to add an effect to fired bullets. Should be executed from Fired Event Handler.

syntaxes.code: [unit, nil, nil, nil, ammoType] call BIS_fnc_effectFiredRifle

args.name: unit
args.desc: the unit, the effect should be added to

args.name: ammoType
args.desc: the type of ammo the effect should be triggered for

bis_fnc_effectfiredsmokelauncher.title: BIS_fnc_effectFiredSmokeLauncher

bis_fnc_effectfiredsmokelauncher_boat.title: BIS_fnc_effectFiredSmokeLauncher_boat

bis_fnc_effectkilledsecondaries.title: BIS_fnc_effectKilledSecondaries
bis_fnc_effectkilledsecondaries.description:
//Small secondary fuel explosions
//By Maddmatt for Arma 2

bis_fnc_setppeffecttemplate.title: BIS_fnc_setPPeffectTemplate
bis_fnc_setppeffecttemplate.description: Apply post-process effects according to template from CfgPostprocessTemplates.

args.name:
template: String - (Optional, default "Default") the template name. An invalid value will fall back to "Default".
Available game templates are:
* "Default"
* "BlackAndWhite"
* "Mediterranean"
* "EastWind"
* "RealIsBrown"
transition
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) time to apply the post-process

args.name: global
args.desc: (Optional, default isMultiplayer) should the post-process be broadcast over the network

bis_fnc_feedbackmain.title: BIS_fnc_feedbackMain
bis_fnc_feedbackmain.description: Main feedback FSM, used for feedback effects (fatigue, drowning, injury etc.). Internal use only.

bis_fnc_bloodeffect.title: BIS_fnc_bloodEffect
bis_fnc_bloodeffect.description: Adds the bleeding effect post-processing effect to the players screen.

args.name: Number - duration in (milli?)seconds in which effect should be visible.

bis_fnc_damagechanged.title: BIS_fnc_damageChanged
bis_fnc_damagechanged.description: Handle effects caused by changing of damage.

bis_fnc_dirteffect.title: BIS_fnc_dirtEffect
bis_fnc_dirteffect.description:
Screen dirt (texture) postprocess. 
Displays dust PP according to damage obtained from near explosion; takes array from "Explosion" event handler.

args.name: unit
args.desc: who gets the damage. Unused and useless parameter

args.name: damage
args.desc: damage given to unit by explosion

bis_fnc_fatigueeffect.title: BIS_fnc_fatigueEffect
bis_fnc_fatigueeffect.description: Effects for high fatigue values. Internal engine use only, as it relies on internal BIS_* variables.

bis_fnc_feedbackinit.title: BIS_fnc_feedbackInit
bis_fnc_feedbackinit.description: Init function for feedback system. Declaration of variables, eventhandlers, etc. for in-game effects. Engine use only.

bis_fnc_healing.title: BIS_fnc_healing
bis_fnc_healing.description: Healing postprocess. Supposed to give healing postprocess effects.

bis_fnc_incapacitatedeffect.title: BIS_fnc_incapacitatedEffect
bis_fnc_incapacitatedeffect.description: A draft of incapacitated effects function.

bis_fnc_indicatebleeding.title: BIS_fnc_indicateBleeding
bis_fnc_indicatebleeding.description: Shows a PP effect which indicates bleeding.

bis_fnc_radialred.title: BIS_fnc_radialRed
bis_fnc_radialred.description: Red radial postprocess (hit damage, fire damage). Parameters are the same as the first four of HandleDamage EH.

args.name: shooter
args.desc: (Optional, default objNull) requested only if bodyPart is not empty string

bis_fnc_radialredout.title: BIS_fnc_radialRedOut
bis_fnc_radialredout.description: Removes red radial postprocess (fire damage) created by BIS_fnc_radialRed.

bis_fnc_relscaleddist.title: BIS_fnc_relScaledDist
bis_fnc_relscaleddist.description: Exponentially inflated rational number between 0 and 1, with 1 being center and 0 being edge of the trigger. This function can be used to check where in a trigger area an object is. Is it near the border of the trigger area the number will go against 0.

bis_fnc_terraingradangle.title: BIS_fnc_terrainGradAngle
bis_fnc_terraingradangle.description:
Returns the gradient angle (in radians) of the terrain at a specified position and a compass direction.
It is an angle of the slope of a tangent plane to the terrain at the specified position in the specified direction.

args.name: direction
args.desc: direction where should be gradient calculated (compass direction)

bis_fnc_isinsidearea.title: BIS_fnc_isInsideArea
bis_fnc_isinsidearea.description: Detects whether a position is within a square area of given size about center.

args.name: center
args.desc: center Position of area to check

returns.desc: true when position is in area, false otherwise

bis_fnc_relposobject.title: BIS_fnc_relPosObject
bis_fnc_relposobject.description: Place an object relative to another object, like a setRelPos command.

args.name: direction
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) direction of the child object

bis_fnc_groupindicator.title: BIS_fnc_groupIndicator
bis_fnc_groupindicator.description: Displays Group Indicator (to the right of the screen in )

args.name:
argument: Array - case-sensitive, can be:
* [] - displays Group Indicator
* ["Exit"] - closes Group Indicator

bis_fnc_guieffecttiles.title: BIS_fnc_guiEffectTiles
bis_fnc_guieffecttiles.description: Used in dialogs to animate background UAV tiles. See notes for a full working example.

bis_fnc_cinemaborder.title: BIS_fnc_cinemaBorder
bis_fnc_cinemaborder.description: Creates cinematic borders. Player cannot move during cutscene.

args.name:
mode: Number - can be:
*0 - In
*1 - Out

bis_fnc_texttiles.title: BIS_fnc_textTiles
bis_fnc_texttiles.description:
File:BIS_fnc_textTiles.gif400
Shows an animated text with background tiles.

syntaxes.code: [content, position, tileSize, duration, fadeInOutTime, tileTransparency] spawn BIS_fnc_textTiles

args.name:
content: String or Structured Text
* String - path to texure
* Structured Text - formatted text

position: Boolean or Array (optional, default [0, 0, 1, 1])
* Boolean - true to use mission area set in the layout options, false for full screen
* Array - screen space coordinates in format [x, y, w, h]

tileSize: Number or Array (optional, default 10 ([10,10])
* Number - tile size in screen space coordinates. Tile will be square
* Array - tile size in screen space coordinates in format [w, h]

fadeInOutTime: Number or Array - (optional, default 0) duration of the fade effect in seconds
* Array - format [fadeIn, fadeOut] 
* Number - duration of the fadeIn/Out effect
tileTransparency
args.desc: (optional, default 0.3) transparency or alpha value of the tiles. 0 means invisible and 1 fully visible

bis_fnc_titlecard.title: BIS_fnc_titlecard
bis_fnc_titlecard.description: Display a mission-specific titlecard before the mission begins. Only works the first time it is called.

args.name: source: Object or Position - live feed source
target: Object or Position - live feed target
receiver
args.desc: player that will see the feed - if not local, function will do nothing

args.name:
effect: Number - (Optional, default 0)  live feed effect. Can be one of:
* -1: reset
*  0: normal
*  1: night vision
*  2: thermal imaging

returns.desc: true if successful, false if not

bis_fnc_livefeedeffects.title: BIS_fnc_liveFeedEffects
bis_fnc_livefeedeffects.description: Add effect to the current live feed.

args.name:
effect: Number - (Optional, default 0) live feed effect. Can be one of:
* -1: reset
*  0: normal
*  1: night vision
*  2: thermal imaging

returns.desc: true if successful, false if not

bis_fnc_livefeedsetsource.title: BIS_fnc_liveFeedSetSource
bis_fnc_livefeedsetsource.description: Set the source of the current live feed.

args.name:
source:
* Object
* Position
* Array: in the format [object, [x, y, z]]

returns.desc: true if successful, false if not

bis_fnc_livefeedsettarget.title: BIS_fnc_liveFeedSetTarget
bis_fnc_livefeedsettarget.description: Set the target of the current live feed.

returns.desc: true if successful, false if not.
true if successful, false if not

bis_fnc_establishingshot.title: BIS_fnc_establishingShot
bis_fnc_establishingshot.description: Plays a fake UAV observational sequence which serves as an establishing shot. File:BIS_fnc_establishingShot.gif400

syntaxes.code: [target, text, altitude, radius, angle, rotation, iconOptions, mode, fadeIn, waitTime] spawn BIS_fnc_establishingShot

args.name: target: Object or Array - target or target's position
radius
args.desc: (Optional, default 200) radius of the circular movement in meters

args.name: angle
args.desc: (Optional, default random) viewing angle in degrees

args.name:
rotation: Number - (Optional, default random) direction of camera movement
* 0: anti-clockwise
* 1: clockwise

iconOptions: Array of Arrays - (Optional, default  inline[]) each array in format [icon, color, target, sizeX, sizeY, angle, text, shadow]:
* icon: String - path to icon texture
* color: Array format Color (RGBA)
* target: Object, Position or Group - where the texture should be drawn
* sizeX: Number - (Optional, default 1) icon width
* sizeY: Number - (Optional, default 1) icon height
* angle: Number - (Optional, default random 360) icon angle
* text: String - (Optional, default "") text displayed underneath the icon
* shadow: Number - (Optional, default 0)
** 0 to draw a flat icon
** 1 to draw a shadowed icon

mode: Number - (Optional, default 0)
* 0: normal (disables saving and sets `BIS_missionStarted` to nil)
* 1: world scenes
fadeIn
args.desc: (Optional, default true) fade in after completion

args.name: waitTime
args.desc: (Optional, default 2) wait time in seconds after the shot has been completed

bis_fnc_ctrlfittotextheight.title: BIS_fnc_ctrlFitToTextHeight
bis_fnc_ctrlfittotextheight.description: Resize structured text control to fit its text height.

args.name: control
args.desc: the control which should be scaled

bis_fnc_setidcstreamfriendly.title: BIS_fnc_setIDCStreamFriendly
bis_fnc_setidcstreamfriendly.description: Shows or hides UI control according to state of the Stream Friendly UI switch in Game Options.

args.name: IDC
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) control IDC when the first parameter is a display

returns.desc: true when visible, false when hidden

bis_fnc_typetext.title: BIS_fnc_typeText
bis_fnc_typetext.description:
Types a structured text on the screen, letter by letter, cursor blinking.
File:BIS_fnc_typeText.gif400

args.name:
stringLines:
* Array of Strings - array containing lines of text with same structured text formatting.
* Array of Arrays format [text, format, blinkCount]:
** text: String - (Optional, default "")
** format: String - (Optional, default "<t align = 'center' shadow = '1' size = '0.7'>%1</t><br/>")
** blinkCount: Number - (Optional, default 5) number of cursor blinks after text typing

bis_fnc_typetext2.title: BIS_fnc_typeText2
bis_fnc_typetext2.description:
File:BIS_fnc_typeText2.gif400
Types a structured text on the screen, letter by letter, cursor blinking. Note that line returns are manual, unlike BIS_fnc_typeText.

syntaxes.code: [stringLines, posX, posY, alignBottom, rootFormat, abortParams, abortCond, playSounds] call BIS_fnc_typeText2

args.name:
stringLines:
* Array of Strings - array containing lines of text with same structured text formatting.
* Array of Array of Strings [text, format, color]
** text: String - (Optional, default  inline"")
** format: String - (Optional, default  inline"align = 'center' size = '0.7'") a linebreak is defined as "<br/>" and this only!
** color: String - (Optional, default  inline"#ffffff")

bis_fnc_ctrlsetscale.title: BIS_fnc_ctrlSetScale
bis_fnc_ctrlsetscale.description: Scale a control while maintaining its centering.

args.name: control
args.desc: the control which should be scaled

args.name: display
args.desc: (Optional) display to use to show the credits

args.name: mode
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) 0 to start the credits, 1 to end them

bis_fnc_credits_movieconfig.title: BIS_fnc_credits_movieConfig
bis_fnc_credits_movieconfig.description:
/*
	File: fn_credits_movieConfig.sqf

	Description:
	Movie credits config preprocessor.

	Parameter(s):
	_this select 0: Number - Index of item in config (CfgCredits >> CreditsMovie >> item)
	
	Returned value:
	_array: Array
	_array select 0: String - Position name (and tags) as structured text.
	_array select 1: String - Names (and tags) as structured text.
	_array select 2: Number - Required space coeficient (numberOfNames * textSizeCoef), -1 if config entry doesn't exist
*/

bis_fnc_credits_moviesupport.title: BIS_fnc_credits_movieSupport
bis_fnc_credits_moviesupport.description:
/*
	File: fn_credits_movieSupport.sqf

	Description:
	Movie credits supporters preprocessor.

	Parameter(s):
	None.
	
	Returned value:
	_array: Array
	_array select 0: String - Position name (and tags) as structured text.
	_array select 1: String - Names (and tags) as structured text - 1st paragraph.
	_array select 2: String - Names (and tags) as structured text - 2nd paragraph.
	_array select 3: String - Names (and tags) as structured text - 3rd paragraph.
	_array select 4: Number - Required space coeficient (numberOfNamesInOneParagraph * textSizeCoef)
*/

bis_fnc_showunitinfo.title: BIS_fnc_showUnitInfo
bis_fnc_showunitinfo.description: Hides or shows weapon information. Also hides grenades information.

args.name: showUnitInfo
args.desc: true to show weapon information, false to hide it

bis_fnc_toupperdisplaytexts.title: BIS_fnc_toUpperDisplayTexts
bis_fnc_toupperdisplaytexts.description: Converts text of selected classes in one display to upper-case except classes with name PlayersName. Also searches inside CT_CONTROLS_GROUPs.

args.name: displayClass
args.desc: class name of the display to manipulate

args.name: controlClasses: Array of Strings - class names of parents of controls you want to turn upper case (e. g. ["RscText", "RscTitle"])
blacklist: Array of Strings - (Optional: Default []) Class names of controls you don't want to turn upper case (e. g. ["CA_VehicleAuthor"])

* `a3\ui_f_oldman\video\spotlight_fd14.ogv`
* `a3\ui_f_orange\video\spotlight_a.ogv`

* `a3\ui_f_tank\video\spotlight_a.ogv`

</spoiler>
subtitle

bis_fnc_showmarkers.title: BIS_fnc_showMarkers

args.desc: can be "show" or "hide". Any other value will be ignored.

args.name: markers: Array of Strings - markers to show/hide

bis_fnc_isinzoom.title: BIS_fnc_isInZoom
bis_fnc_isinzoom.description: Checks if map zoom level is in between given interval.

args.name: hintClass
args.desc: (Optional, default "") class of hint (in case of warning or error is used in logged info)

bis_fnc_advhintcall.title: BIS_fnc_advHintCall
bis_fnc_advhintcall.description:
Advanced hint call, creates hint itself.
This function gets parameters from variable BIS_fnc_advHint_hint:
	BIS_fnc_advHint_hint select 0: String - Class of hint
	BIS_fnc_advHint_hint select 1: String - Structured text of full hint
	BIS_fnc_advHint_hint select 2: String - Structured text of short hint
	BIS_fnc_advHint_hint select 3: Number - Duration of short hint in seconds
	BIS_fnc_advHint_hint select 4: String - Condition for hiding of short hint (default: "false")
	BIS_fnc_advHint_hint select 5: Number - Duration of full hint in seconds
	BIS_fnc_advHint_hint select 6: String - Condition for hiding of full hint (default: "false")
	BIS_fnc_advHint_hint select 7: Boolean - True shows directly full hint (default: false)
	BIS_fnc_advHint_hint select 8: Boolean - True for using of sound (default: true)

args.name: fullText
args.desc: true to show full text, false to only show small hint notification

bis_fnc_addweapon.title: BIS_fnc_addWeapon
bis_fnc_addweapon.description:
Adds a weapon to the specified unit, with magazine classnames taken from the weapon's config (in CfgWeapons).
This function does not remove magazines nor weapons prior to adding the new weapon, so that still has to be done manually.

args.name:
type: Number or String - (Optional, default 0)
* Number - Index of magazine name that should be used - found in  langcpp inlinemagazines = {} array.
* String - Magazine name to be used.

bis_fnc_basicbackpack.title: BIS_fnc_basicBackpack
bis_fnc_basicbackpack.description: Determines basic backpack with no equipment present (ie empty).

bis_fnc_loadinventory.title: BIS_fnc_loadInventory
bis_fnc_loadinventory.description: Adds a predefined loadout (either via `CfgVehicles`, `CfgRespawnInventory`, or a custom inventory saved via BIS_fnc_saveInventory) to a specified unit.

args.name: Object - unit to receive the loadout

Config or Array - can be one of:
* Config: config entry of loadout found in either `CfgVehicles` or `CfgRespawnInventory`
* Array in format [Namespace, Group or Object, String] or BIS_fnc_saveInventory's output
Array - (Optional, default  inline[]) array of Strings that define what part of the loadout to ignore, e.g ["weapons", "uniform"]

bis_fnc_markwaypoints.title: BIS_fnc_markWaypoints
bis_fnc_markwaypoints.description:
/*

	Description:
	Creates a marker on each uncompleted waypoint and marks it checked after completing that WP.
	Note: "On Activation" WP code is used for handling the markers; if this code is overwritten during the course, it can break this functionality

	Parameter(s):
	_this select 0: OBJECT - unit who will have its waypoints marked
	_this select 1 (Optional, use "" for default): STRING - text of hint shown after completing a waypoint, %1 is used for WP number (default "")
	_this select 2 (Optional, use [] for default): ARRAY of STRINGS - marker text format for [uncompleted, completed] waypoints, %1 is used for WP number (default ["%1", "%1"])
	_this select 3 (Optional, use [] for default): ARRAY of STRINGS - marker icon for [uncompleted, completed] waypoints (default ["mil_circle", "mil_circle"])
	_this select 4 (Optional, use [] for default): ARRAY of STRINGS - marker color for [uncompleted, completed] waypoints (default ["ColorRed", "ColorGreen"])
	_this select 5 (Optional, use [] for default): ARRAY of NUMBERS - marker size for [uncompleted, completed] waypoints (default [0.75, 0.75])

	Returns:
	NOTHING
*/

bis_fnc_markertotrigger.title: BIS_fnc_markerToTrigger
bis_fnc_markertotrigger.description: Makes an existing or new marker cover a trigger area.

args.name: markerName
args.desc: marker name - if no marker uses the name, a marker will be created

args.name: trigger
args.desc: trigger that will be covered by the marker

args.name: localChange: Boolean (Optional, default false) are changes local (local marker creation and/or local marker changes)

returns.desc: marker name or "" if marker couldn't be moved or created or if provided markerName is ""

bis_fnc_triggertomarker.title: BIS_fnc_triggerToMarker
bis_fnc_triggertomarker.description: Makes an existing or new trigger cover a marker area.

args.name: trigger
args.desc: trigger that will be used to cover the marker. objNull to create a new trigger

returns.desc: the (created) trigger. objNull if marker is not rectangular or elliptical.

bis_fnc_exportmaptobitxt.title: BIS_fnc_exportMapToBiTXT
bis_fnc_exportmaptobitxt.description: Returns terrain height map to BiTXT (Universal Bistudio TXT) format, which can be imported to Object Builder. Output is also copied to clipboard.

args.name: resolution
args.desc: (Optional, default 64) object resolution, i.e, number of points per side

args.name: zCoeff
args.desc: (Optional, default 2) vertical coefficient. All Z coordinates will be multiplied by this number to highlight hills and mountains

returns.desc: height map, same data as in the clipboard

bis_fnc_missiontasks.title: BIS_fnc_missionTasks
bis_fnc_missiontasks.description:
/*

	Description:
	Header function of local mission tasks.
	Automatically declares following variables:
		_taskID: STRING
		_taskState: STRING
		_taskExists: BOOL

	Parameter(s):
		0: STRING - unique mode
		1 (Optional): ANY - additional params
		2 (Optional): CODE - specific task function (default: "BIS_fnc_missionTasksLocal")

	Returns:
	BOOL
*/

bis_fnc_missionconversations.title: BIS_fnc_missionConversations
bis_fnc_missionconversations.description:
/*

	Description:
	Header function of local mission conversations

	Parameter(s):
		0: STRING - unique mode
		1 (Optional): ANY - additional params

	Returns:
	BOOL
*/

bis_fnc_iscampaign.title: BIS_fnc_isCampaign
bis_fnc_iscampaign.description: Checks to see if a mission is being run in a campaign.

returns.desc: true if being run in a campaign, false if not

bis_fnc_missionhandlers.title: BIS_fnc_missionHandlers
bis_fnc_missionhandlers.description:
#define VAR_RELOADS	(missionname + "_reloads_" + str ismultiplayer)

//--- Mission end type and rating

bis_fnc_trackmissiontime.title: BIS_fnc_trackMissionTime
bis_fnc_trackmissiontime.description: Tracks mission time by storing time in profileNamespace.

bis_fnc_fadeeffect.title: BIS_fnc_fadeEffect
bis_fnc_fadeeffect.description: Easily carry out complex fading. Default values will be used if parameters are not defined or set to nil.

syntaxes.code: [fadeInOrOut, blackOrWhite, duration, blur, music, ending, success] spawn BIS_fnc_fadeEffect

args.name: fadeInOrOut
args.desc: (Optional, default 1) 0 to fade out, 1 to fade in

args.name: blur
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) 0 to not blur, 1 to blur (blur-in for fade-in, blur-out for fade-out)

args.name: music
args.desc: (Optional, default "") only for fade-out music class name defined in CfgMusic

args.name: ending
args.desc: (Optional, default "") "" to not end the mission, else a value compatible with endMission or failMission. Will end mission only for the local player

args.name: success
args.desc: (Optional, default 1) if ending != "" 1 to end mission with success, 0 to fail mission

bis_fnc_findoverwatch.title: BIS_fnc_findOverwatch
bis_fnc_findoverwatch.description: Selects a position that provides overwatch onto another position.

syntaxes.code: [target, maxDistance, minDistance, minHeightAbove, searchCentre] call BIS_fnc_findOverwatch

args.name: maxDistance
args.desc: (Optional, default 500) maximum distance from target in meters

args.name: minDistance
args.desc: (Optional, default 100) minimum distance from target in meters

args.name: minHeightAbove
args.desc: (Optional, default 50) minimum height in relation to target in meters

args.name: searchCentre
args.desc: (Optional, default target) position to start looking from, if different from target pos

returns.desc: target position if no result were found

bis_fnc_ondiarychanged.title: BIS_fnc_onDiaryChanged
bis_fnc_ondiarychanged.description:
/*

	Description:
	Register code to be executed when diary item changes.

	Arguments passed into code are:
		0: DISPLAY - map display
		1: BOOL - true if clicked on subject list, false when on record list (clicking on subject may also trigger record)
		2: STRING - subject name
		3: STRING - record name
		4: ANY - passed arguments (index of onDiaryChanged code when no custom arguments were used)

	Parameter(s):
	_this:
		CODE
		ARRAY - code with custom arguments in format [CODE,ARG1,ARG2,...]
		NUMBER - remove code of given index

	Returns:
	NUMBER - index of onDiaryChanged code
*/

bis_fnc_colorrgbatohtml.title: BIS_fnc_colorRGBAtoHTML
bis_fnc_colorrgbatohtml.description: Converts RGBA color format to #AARRGGBB HTML color format.

args.name: colorArray: Color (RGBA) - in [r, g, b, a] format

bis_fnc_rankparams.title: BIS_fnc_rankParams
bis_fnc_rankparams.description:
Return information about military rank.

	1: STRING - requited data, can be one of following:
		"displayName" - full localized name (e.g. "Major")
		"displayNameShort" - short localized name (e.g. "Maj.")
		"classname" - system name (e.g. "MAJOR")
		"texture" - path to rank insignia

args.name:
source: Number, String or Object - can be one of:
* Number - rank ID
* String -  rank system name (e.g. "PRIVATE", "CORPORAL", …)
* Object - person whose rank is checked

infoType: String - can be one of:
* "displayName" - full localized name (e.g. "Major")
* "displayNameShort" - short localized name (e.g. "Maj.")
* "classname" - system name (e.g. "MAJOR")
* "texture" - path to rank insignia

bis_fnc_colorrgbatotexture.title: BIS_fnc_colorRGBAtoTexture
bis_fnc_colorrgbatotexture.description:
Converts RGB color format to procedural texture, e.g `[0,0,0,1]` becomes `"#(argb,8,8,3)color(0,0,0,1)"`.
Values are in range 0..1.

returns.desc: procedural texture to format "#(argb,8,8,3)color( stylecolor: redR, stylecolor: greenG, stylecolor: blueB, stylecolor: greyA)"

bis_fnc_healtheffects.title: BIS_fnc_healthEffects
bis_fnc_healtheffects.description: Effects when player is hit. Parameters are sent by the HandleDamage event handler.

bis_fnc_texturemarker.title: BIS_fnc_textureMarker
bis_fnc_texturemarker.description: Checks whether texture is defined in CfgMarkers and if so, returns the marker texture.

returns.desc: icon texture path, or wantedMarker if not found

bis_fnc_texturevehicleicon.title: BIS_fnc_textureVehicleIcon
bis_fnc_texturevehicleicon.description: Checks whether icon is defined in CfgVehicleIcons and if so, returns the icon.

returns.desc: icon texture path, or wantedIcon if not found

bis_fnc_localize.title: BIS_fnc_localize
bis_fnc_localize.description: Checks if passed string is localization key and if so, return the localized text. Else, returns the passed string itself.

returns.desc: the localized text behind the key or the key itself (if not localized).

bis_fnc_colorconfigtorgba.title: BIS_fnc_colorConfigToRGBA
bis_fnc_colorconfigtorgba.description: Converts config color format to RGBA array of numbers.

bis_fnc_keycode.title: BIS_fnc_keyCode
bis_fnc_keycode.description: Returns DIK code of a given key.

args.name:
input:
* Number: Key code
* String: Key name
* Boolean: Return key definitions

bis_fnc_addscriptedeventhandler.title: BIS_fnc_addScriptedEventHandler
bis_fnc_addscriptedeventhandler.description: Adds a Scripted Event Handler and returns its ID. Additionally, the "ScriptedEventHandlerAdded" Scripted EH is called. For the full list of all available Scripted EHs see Arma 3: Scripted Event Handlers.

args.name: namespace: Namespace, Object, Group, Location, Boolean, Control or Display - namespace in which the EH is stored
code: Code or String - the code that is executed when the EH fires. The magic variable _thisScriptedEventHandler can be used to access the event handler ID within the code.

returns.desc: the ID of the new Event Handler

bis_fnc_callscriptedeventhandler.title: BIS_fnc_callScriptedEventHandler
bis_fnc_callscriptedeventhandler.description: Calls all the codes assigned to scripted event handler with given name. Since  the code receives current EH id in the special variable: `_thisScriptedEventHandler`

args.name: namespace: Namespace, Object, Group, Location, Boolean, Control or Display - namespace in which handler is saved
arguments
args.desc: array of arguments passed to the EH code

args.name: returnResults
args.desc: (Optional, default false) if true EH will place results from each code execution into an array using EH id as index

returns.desc: array with EH results or empty array

bis_fnc_startloadingscreen.title: BIS_fnc_startLoadingScreen
bis_fnc_startloadingscreen.description: Register a loading screen. Start the loading when it is the first one registered.

args.name: screenId
args.desc: screen ID, will be used in BIS_fnc_endLoadingScreen

args.name: layout
args.desc: loading text. has no effect in

bis_fnc_endloadingscreen.title: BIS_fnc_endLoadingScreen
bis_fnc_endloadingscreen.description: Unregister a loading screen. When none other remains, end the loading.

bis_fnc_progressloadingscreen.title: BIS_fnc_progressLoadingScreen
bis_fnc_progressloadingscreen.description: Progress scripted loading screen. The value will be preserved even when a new screen is opened.

bis_fnc_groupvehicles.title: BIS_fnc_groupVehicles
bis_fnc_groupvehicles.description: Returns all vehicles a group possesses, assigned vehicles can be included.

args.name: target: Object or Group - the unit or group to check, if unit is given it is group is then used
assignedVeh
args.desc: if assigned vehicles should also be returned (vehicles that unit's may not be inside of but assigned to)

returns.desc: list of all vehicles in control/assigned to the group, empty if group has none

bis_fnc_nearestroad.title: BIS_fnc_nearestRoad
bis_fnc_nearestroad.description: Find the nearest road segment to certain position, within given radius.

returns.desc: nearest road object, objNull if not found

bis_fnc_interpolateweather.title: BIS_fnc_interpolateWeather
bis_fnc_interpolateweather.description:
/*

	Description:
	Interpolate weather (overcast and fog) according to 2 boundry dates and their weather conditions.

	Parameter(s):
	_this select 0: array	- _date1 	[_year1,_month1,_day1,_hour1,_min1]
	_this select 1: array	- _weather1	[_overcast1,_fog1]
	_this select 2: array	- _date2 	[_year2,_month2,_day2,_hour2,_min2]
	_this select 3: array	- _weather2	[_overcast2,_fog2]
	_this select 4: array	- _subjectDate 	[_year,_month,_day,_hour,_min] (default: current date)

	Returns:
	[_interpolatedOvercast,_interpolatedFog]

	Example:
	[_overcast,_fog] = [[2035,1,5,24,00],[0.1,0.5],[2035,1,10,24,00],[0.3,0.2],[2035,1,7,24,00]] call BIS_fnc_interpolateWeather;
*/

bis_fnc_jukebox.title: BIS_fnc_jukebox
bis_fnc_jukebox.description: Plays music, depending on the player group status.

args.name:
parameters: Array - (Optional)

* "initialize": [stealthMusics, combatMusics, safeMusics, volume, transition, radius, executionRate, noRepeat]
** stealthMusics: Array of Strings
** combatMusics: Array of Strings
** safeMusics: Array of Strings
** volume: Number
* "terminate": none
* "readContainerFromConfig": [wantedTheme]
* "isInitialized": none
* "forceBehaviour": [behaviour]
** behaviour: String - can be "stealth", "combat" or "safe". Any other value will reset the forced behaviour.
* "status": none
* "randomMusic": [container]
** container: Array of Strings - music list to choose from
* "selectMusic": none
* "playMusic": [musicName]
** musicName: String
* "nearEnemies": none
* "hasContact": none
* "isContact": none
* "isStealth": none
* "isCombat": none
* "isSafe": none
* "onEachFrame": none

bis_fnc_fixdate.title: BIS_fnc_fixDate
bis_fnc_fixdate.description: Checks the array with date data and makes sure the values are within the boundries.

args.name: date: Array format Date - date to be checked

bis_fnc_isleapyear.title: BIS_fnc_isLeapYear
bis_fnc_isleapyear.description: Returns true if given year is a leap year, otherwise false.

bis_fnc_monthdays.title: BIS_fnc_monthDays
bis_fnc_monthdays.description: Returns number of days in given month. Takes in account for leap year.

returns.desc: number of days in given month

bis_fnc_blackout.title: BIS_fnc_blackOut
bis_fnc_blackout.description: Register a black screen. Start the black screen when the first request is registered.

args.name: id
args.desc: black screen id used for registration (case sensitive)

args.name: smoothing
args.desc: (Optional, default true) smooth transition - false for an immediate blackout

args.name: fadeSpeed
args.desc: (Optional, default 2) transition duration (if smoothing is true)

bis_fnc_blackin.title: BIS_fnc_blackIn
bis_fnc_blackin.description: Unregister a black screen. When none other black screen is registered, fade it out.

args.name: id
args.desc: black screen id used for registration (case sensitive)

args.name: smoothing
args.desc: (Optional, default true) smooth transition - false for an immediate blackout

args.name: fadeSpeed
args.desc: (Optional, default 2) transition duration (if smoothing is true)

bis_fnc_executestackedeventhandler.title: BIS_fnc_executeStackedEventHandler
bis_fnc_executestackedeventhandler.description: This function executes the stacked items.

bis_fnc_initexpo.description: Disable parts of the main menu during public presentation. Press  to toggle the lock.

bis_fnc_enablesaving.title: BIS_fnc_enableSaving
bis_fnc_enablesaving.description: Controls the enabling of saving. Will only enable saving if there are no remaining requests for disabled saving.

args.name: id
args.desc: unique id previously used to disable saving via BIS_fnc_disableSaving

returns.desc: true if successful, false if not

bis_fnc_earthquake.title: BIS_fnc_earthquake
bis_fnc_earthquake.description: Earthquake simulation - now just camera shake and sound. Stamina is impacted by the earthquake too. Earthquake will last between 13 and 20 seconds. While earthquake is in progress missionNamespace variable `BIS_fnc_earthquake_inprogress` will be true.

args.name: intensity
args.desc: (Optional, default 2) can be 1, 2, 3 or 4. Any other value will fall back to the default value

bis_fnc_initmodules.title: BIS_fnc_initModules
bis_fnc_initmodules.description: Wait until all modules using the Arma 3: Module Framework are initialised.

bis_fnc_initmultiplayer.description: Multiplayer mission init, executed automatically upon mission start.

bis_fnc_execfsm.description: Execute the scripted FSM. Shell for execFSM command

bis_fnc_execvm.title: BIS_fnc_execVM
bis_fnc_execvm.description: execVM desired script with desired argument(s). This function is only really useful when combined with BIS_fnc_MP to execute a script remotely.

args.name: arguments

bis_fnc_execremote.title: BIS_fnc_execRemote
bis_fnc_execremote.description: This function is now an alias to BIS_fnc_MP.

bis_fnc_addscore.title: BIS_fnc_addScore
bis_fnc_addscore.description: Adds a set amount of points to the score of a unit (MP only)

args.name: Object - unit to add score to.
Number - number of points (score) to add to unit.

bis_fnc_setrespawndelay.title: BIS_fnc_setRespawnDelay
bis_fnc_setrespawndelay.description:
/*

	Description:
	Increase the respawn time based on a condition

	Parameter(s):
		0: CODE - Condition, must return BOOL
		1: NUMBER - delay in seconds which is applied when the condition is true
		2: STRING - description displayed when the delay is in effect

	Returns:
	NOTHING
*/

bis_fnc_onplayerconnected.title: BIS_fnc_onPlayerConnected
bis_fnc_onplayerconnected.description: Executes a function on server every time a player connects the mission.

args.name:
code: Code or String - function name or code to be executed. Following parameters are passed to the function or code:
*0: Player
*1: Params
params
args.desc: parameters passed to the code or function

bis_fnc_missiontimeleft.title: BIS_fnc_missionTimeLeft
bis_fnc_missiontimeleft.description: Returns time in seconds until the mission end. Remaining time can be set using estimatedTimeLeft command or using BIS_fnc_countdown.

args.name:
timeInSeconds - can be:
* Number:
** Any number to set the length of the countdown in seconds
** -1 to set the countdown to nil
** 0 to return the left-over time
* Boolean:
** true to find out if countdown is active and if there is left-over time
global - Boolean: True to set it globally (Optional) Default: true

bis_fnc_filterstring.title: BIS_fnc_filterString
bis_fnc_filterstring.description: Removes characters from a string based on the list of allowed characters.

returns.desc: filtered text with only the allowed characters supplied in the filter.

bis_fnc_instring.description: Find a string within a string.

returns.desc: true if search term is found, false if not

bis_fnc_ordinalnumber.title: BIS_fnc_ordinalNumber
bis_fnc_ordinalnumber.description: Return number as ordinal number (e.g. 1 become "1st")

bis_fnc_romannumeral.title: BIS_fnc_romanNumeral
bis_fnc_romannumeral.description: Convert integer to roman numerals (e.g. 42 becomes "XLII").

bis_fnc_phoneticalword.title: BIS_fnc_phoneticalWord
bis_fnc_phoneticalword.description: Convert number to NATO phonetical alphabet word (e.g. 2 becomes "Bravo") or letter of alphabet.

args.name: short
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true for the short version, false for the long version.

returns.desc: phonetical word or letter of alphabet. In case of full word the returned string is localised.

bis_fnc_teamcolor.title: BIS_fnc_teamColor
bis_fnc_teamcolor.description: Convert number to color team name or color.

args.name: getColour
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to get Color (RGBA), false to get localized team name

bis_fnc_aligntabs.title: BIS_fnc_alignTabs
bis_fnc_aligntabs.description: Align two columns divided by tabs. A tab counts for 8 characters.

bis_fnc_splitstring.title: BIS_fnc_splitString
bis_fnc_splitstring.description: Splits given string according to given separator(s).

args.name: separators

bis_fnc_strategicmapopen.title: BIS_fnc_strategicMapOpen
bis_fnc_strategicmapopen.description:
Creates a strategic map.
File:A3 strategicMap.jpg600

syntaxes.code: [display, pos, missions, ORBATs, markers, images, weather, night, scale, simulation, label, missionName, missionIcon] call BIS_fnc_strategicMapOpen

args.name: display
args.desc: parent display. When empty, mission display is used.

args.name: pos: Array format Position - default view position in format [x,y,y] or [x,y]

missions: Array - list of missions, each Array in format:
* 0: Position - 2D or 3D position of mission
* 1: Code - Expression executed when user clicks on mission icon
* 2: String - Mission name
* 3: String - Short description
* 4: String - Name of mission's player
* 5: String - Path to overview image
* 6: Number - size multiplier for overview image
* 7: Array - parameters for on-click action. Can be accessed in code with  inline_this # 9

ORBATs: Array - list of ORBAT, each Array in format:
* 0: Array format Position - 2D or 3D position
* 1: Config - preview CfgORBAT group
* 2: Config - topmost displayed CfgORBAT group
* 3: Array of Strings - list of allowed tags
* 4: String - name of mission's player
* 5: Number - maximum number of displayed tiers
markers: Array of Strings - list of markers revealed in strategic map (will be hidden when map is closed)

images: Array - list of custom images, each Array in format:
* 0: String - texture path
* 1: Array format Color (RGBA)
* 2: Array format Position - image position
* 3: Number - image width in meters
* 4: Number - image height in meters
* 5: Number - image angle in degrees
* 6: String - text displayed next to the image
* 7: Boolean - true to show shadow
weather
args.desc: overcast, from 0 - 1, where 1 means cloudy weather

args.name: night
args.desc: true for night version of strategic map (darker with blue tone)

args.name: scale
args.desc: default map scale coeficient (1 is automatic scale)

args.name: simulation: Boolean] - (Optional, default false true to enable simulation while the map is opened
label
args.desc: (Optional, default "Select a mission") bottom bar action label text

args.name: missionName
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true to show icon label as a mission name

args.name:
missionIcon: String - (Optional, default "\A3\Ui_f\data\Map\GroupIcons\badge_rotate_%1_gs.paa") path to mission icon texture 
* %1 - Animation frame from 0-6 (optional)
* %2 - Index from 1-9 (optional)
target: Config or Position - either config path to target group, or absolute position in format [x,y,z] or [x,y]

args.name:
position: Object, Group, String or Array
* Object or Group - Object or Group to move unit to. Move to the object position or inside an object if the object is a vehicle, or if group or unit is in vehicle and there is an empty seat
* String - Marker to move unit to. Marker size will be used for random placement area and marker direction for unit direction
* Array - Precise PositionAGL to move unit to. [x,y] array will be converted to [x,y,0]

canBeDead: Boolean - (Optional, default true) whether or not dead are allowed:
* true - moved unit and/or object to which unit is moved can be dead

returns.desc: true: move succeeded, false: move failed

bis_fnc_bleedtickets.title: BIS_fnc_bleedTickets
bis_fnc_bleedtickets.description: Function that handles bleeding ticket system. Tickets are set beforehand using BIS_fnc_respawnTickets.

args.name: sides
args.desc: (Optional, default All sides) array of effected sides

args.name: dominanceRatio
args.desc: (Optional, default 0.5) dominance ratio, values from 0 to 1. Determines how much of a sector a side must hold for bleeding tickets to start

args.name: bleedingAmount
args.desc: (Optional, default 3) amount of tickets bled every step. Optional parameter

args.name: bleedingDelay
args.desc: (Optional, default 5) delay in seconds between every bleeding step

returns.desc: returns "@test" for a task with the variable name "test".

args.name:
owner: String - owner of the task.(Optional) Can be:
* Boolean - true to useall playable units
* Object- specific object
* Group - all objects in the group
* Side - all objects of the given side
* Array - collection of above types
removeFromJIP
args.desc: true to also remove task from JIP queue, default false

args.name: taskID
args.desc: ID or name of the task

returns.desc: returns true if task state is either "SUCCEEDED", "FAILED" or "CANCELED". Returns false for all other states and if task does not exist

syntaxes.code: [owner, taskID, description, destination, state, priority, showNotification, type, visibleIn3D] call BIS_fnc_taskCreate

args.name:
owner: Task owner(s)
* Boolean - true to set task of all playable units
* Object - set task of a specific object
* Group - set tasks of all objects in the group
* Side - set tasks of all objects of the given side
* Array - collection of above types

taskID:
* String - Task ID
* Array - In the format of [task ID, parent task ID]

description:
* Array - Task description in the format ["description", "title", "marker"] - "marker" is depreciated, functionally does nothing
* String - CfgTaskDescriptions class name, if empty string is used then CfgTaskDescriptions is searched for a class matching the tasks TaskID

destination (Optional): Task destination
* Object - Use objNull to set no position
* Array - can be one of:
** format Position
** [target, precision] (as used by setSimpleTaskTarget)
*** target: Object
*** precision: Boolean - false to use owner's knowledge of target, true to force display even if target is unknown to owner

state: (Optional, default "CREATED") task state. Can be:
* String - can be one of following:
** "CREATED"
** "ASSIGNED"
** "AUTOASSIGNED" ("ASSIGNED" when no task is assigned yet, otherwise "CREATED")
** "SUCCEEDED"
** "FAILED"
** "CANCELED"
* Boolean - true to set the task as current
* Number
** 0 or less for false
** > 0 as true
priority
args.desc: (Optional) priority. When the current task is completed, the system selects the one with the largest priority >= 0. To avoid auto assignment of that task, give it a priority of -1.

args.name: showNotification
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true to show notification, false to disable it

args.name: type
args.desc: (Optional, default "") task type from CfgTaskTypes, if not defined, type "" is being used

args.name: visibleIn3D
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to make task always visible in 3D

bis_fnc_taskexists.title: BIS_fnc_taskExists
bis_fnc_taskexists.description: Return true if a task exists.

bis_fnc_taskreal.description: Find the actual task associated with a task name assigned to a unit.

bis_fnc_tasksunit.title: BIS_fnc_tasksUnit
bis_fnc_tasksunit.description: Grab all tasks currently created for a given unit.

bis_fnc_tasksetcurrent.title: BIS_fnc_taskSetCurrent
bis_fnc_tasksetcurrent.description: Set a task to current. Identical to assigning a task.

args.name: showNotification
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true to show notification, false to disable it

args.name:
destination: Object, Array, Position or String - task destination:
* Object - task will be displayed on the object if player knows about it, otherwise it will be on estimated position or even hidden
* Array format [object, forceRealPosition]:
** object: Object - same as above
** forceRealPosition: Boolean - whether or not the task will be on exact object position even if the player does not know about the object
* Position - task will be on given positon
* String - marker name. Task will be at markers current position (Won't update if marker was moved)
showHint
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true to show a hint

args.name: Object or String - vehicle itself or a classname

bis_fnc_prepareao.title: BIS_fnc_prepareAO
bis_fnc_prepareao.description:
Spawns random patrols and/or vehicles in trigger areas with proper names. Side selected in the triggers "Activation" listbox will determine the side of the spawned asset(s).

Trigger names (a.k.a "Trigger text", not "Variable Name") defines the kind of spawn. Supported trigger names are:
* GEN_infantry: spawns random infantry patrol with sentry waypoints (NOTE: only circular triggers are supported, min. axis should be 500m)
* GEN_patrolVeh: spawns a random vehicle. If a civilian unit is synchronized with the trigger, its waypoint will be used by the spawned vehicle
You can specify the vehicle type by typing one of the following into the trigger's "On Act." field:
** car
** apc
** tank
* GEN_ammo: spawns a random number of ammoboxes. You can get and idea of the shape this composition will have by making this trigger rectangular with dimensions 5m x 1m. You can also specify the amount of crates spawned by using min. and max. Timeout values (supported range is 1 to 6 crates).
* GEN_civilCar: spawns a random empty civil car

args.name: density
args.desc: (Optional, default 1) enemy presence density index used for random footpatrols

* "init" - scripting commands, target is referred to as `this`
* "config" - config attributes
includeIdentity
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true to also export face, voice and insignia (applicable to "script" and "init" only)

returns.desc: SQF code or Config text when "config" option is chosen

args.name: unit
args.desc: unit whose inventory should be saved

args.name:
input: Array in format:
*1: Namespace, Group or Object - Target where the loadout is stored 
*2: String - Loadout name
params
args.desc: (Optional, default []) custom parameters stored with the loadout

args.name: delete

args.name: unit

args.name:
input: Array in format:

bis_fnc_arsenal.title: BIS_fnc_arsenal
bis_fnc_arsenal.description: Function used for the Virtual Arsenal. The function features four different modes, each mode comes with its own parameters.

args.name:
mode: String - mode, can be one of:
* "Open" - opens the Arsenal
* "Preload" - preloads item configs, without preloading the configs are parsed the first time it is opened
* "AmmoboxInit" - adds a virtual ammobox. Action to access the Arsenal will be added automatically to all clients
* "AmmoboxExit" - remove virtual ammobox

params: Anything - mode parameters:
* "Open": [full, cargo, center]
** full: Boolean - (Optional, default false) true to open full Arsenal with all items available
** cargo: Object to use as the cargo carrier (cargo is added with the BIS_fnc_addVirtualItemCargo functions)
** center: Object whose arsenal will be modified
* "Preload": no parameters
* "AmmoboxInit": [ammobox, allItems, condition]
** ammobox: Object - Object which should get a virtual ammobox
** allItems: Boolean - (Optional, default false) true to make all items available
** condition: Code - (Optional, default  inline{ true }) condition for the Arsenal to be accessible. Available arguments are the same as in addAction's condition parameter:
*** _target: Object - object to which the action is attached or, if the object is a unit inside of vehicle, the vehicle
*** _this: Object - caller person to whom the action is shown (or not depending on condition)
*** _originalTarget: Object - original object to which the action is attached, regardless if the object/unit is in a vehicle or not
* "AmmoboxExit": [ammobox]
** ammobox: Object - the object to which the Arsenal was added

bis_fnc_addvirtualitemcargo.title: BIS_fnc_addVirtualItemCargo
bis_fnc_addvirtualitemcargo.description:
Add virtual items to an object (e.g., ammo box). Virtual items can be selected in the Arsenal.
If parameters 4 and 5 are used this function can replace BIS_fnc_addVirtualWeaponCargo, BIS_fnc_addVirtualMagazineCargo and BIS_fnc_addVirtualBackpackCargo.

syntaxes.code: [object, itemClasses, addItemsGlobal, arsenal, mode, itemType] call BIS_fnc_addVirtualItemCargo

args.name: object
args.desc: object to which items will be added

args.name: itemClasses: Boolean, String or Array of Strings - item classes
addItemsGlobal
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to add items globally

args.name: arsenal
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true to add Arsenal action

args.name:
mode: Number - (Optional, default 1) defines what the function will do, can be:
* -1 - remove given items
*  0 - return current content
*  1 - add given items

itemType: Number - (Optional, default 0) define the item type, can be:
* 0 - items
* 1 - weapons
* 2 - magazines
* 3 - backpacks

bis_fnc_target.title: BIS_fnc_target
bis_fnc_target.description:
File:A3 BIS_fnc_target.jpg300Target Board display
Handles the shooting targets in the Bootcamp DLC, statistics, animation, etc. (targets such as `TargetBootcampHuman_f`)

{! classwikitable mw-collapsible mw-collapsed stylemin-width: 50em
!+ Action/Parameter Table
! Action (String)
! Parameters (Array) arguments
!-
! initializeInitializes the target and sets it to the "up" position 
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

!-
! terminateDoesn't do anything !! 

!-
! animateAnimate the object to the given position ("up" or "down")
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* position: String - "up" or "down" (default)

!-
! getAnimationPhaseReturn Value: Number - 0 (up) or 1 (down) depending on current state
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

!-
! getAnimationPhaseStringReturn Value: String - "up" or "down" depending on current state
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

!-
!getAnimatedSelectionReturn Value: String - the name of the "animatedSelection" from object config
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

!-
! hitHandles the hit event to animate the target down and up again
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* unit: Object - Unit which shot the target
* damage: Number - Amount of damage done to the target

!-
! hitPartHandles the hit event and stores the data
!
* partsList: Array - Contains list of all parts which got hit (see HitPart EH format) to format [target, shooter]:
** target: Object - Target object of type 'TargetBootcamp_base_F'
** shooter: Object - Unit which shot the target

!-
! getShooterDataIndexReturn Value: Number - index from Shooter Data for specific unit
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target

!-
! getShooterDataReturn Value: Array - all data from Shooter Data for specific unit
Format: `[["uid", ""], ["name", ""], ["shots", [[["time", 0], ["distance", 0], ["weapon", ""], ["direct", 0]]]]]`
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target

!-
! setShooterDataSet Shooter Data for specific unit
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target
* data: Array - Shooter Data

!-
! getShotsDataReturn Value: Array - Shots Data for specific unit
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target

!-
! getShotsDataFromTargetsReturn Value: Number - total amount of shots hit
!
* targets: Array of Object - List of target objects of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target

!-
! getShotsDataWithFilterReturn Value: Array - Shot Data after custom filter
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target
* filter: String - One of "time", "distance", "weapon" or "direct"
* code: Code - Custom code to validate the shot. _this is the value of filtered data

!-
! setShotsDataSet Shots Data for specific unit
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target
* data: Array - Shots Data

!-
! getShootersDataReturn Value: Array - full Shooters Data
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

!-
! setShootersDataSet full Shooters Data
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* data: Array - Shooter Data

!-
! resetShootersDataRemove all data from Shooters Data array
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

!-
! getShooterTemplateReturn Value: Array - template for Shooter Data
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target

!-
! getShotTemplateReturn Value: Array - template for Shot Data (see HitPart EH format)
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* shooter: Object - Unit who shot the target
* projectile: Object - ("_bullet" not used)
* position: Array format Position - ("_position" not used)
* velocity: Array - ("_velocity" not used)
* selection: Array - ("_selection" not used)
* ammo: Array - ("_ammo" not used)
* vector: Array - ("_direction" not used)
* radius: Array - ("_radius" not used)
* surfaceType: String - ("_surface" not used)
* isDirect: Boolean - true if object was directly hit, false if it was hit by indirect/splash damage.

!-
! getShooterByUidReturn Value: Object - corresponding shooter unit
!
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target

!-
! uiOpenOpens the Target Board display
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

!-
! uiOpenToAllOpens the Target Board display for all connected players
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

!-
! uiOnLoadTriggered when display is opened (internal)
!
* display: Display

!-
! uiFillTableTriggered when display is opened, fills UI with Shooters Data (internal)
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* control: Control - "_listBox"

!-
! uiFillTableRowTriggered when display is opened, fills UI with Shooter Data (internal)
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* control: Control - "_listBox"
* data: Array - Shooter Data
!}

bis_fnc_modulerespawnvehicle.title: BIS_fnc_moduleRespawnVehicle
bis_fnc_modulerespawnvehicle.description:
/*

	Description:
	Set vehicle respawn, compatible both with SP and MP.

	Parameter(s):
		0: OBJECT - vehicle
		1:
			NUMBER - respawn delay in seconds (default is 0)
			BOOL - true to remove vehicle respawn (further params are ignored), false to check if the vehicle is marked for respawn
		2: NUMBER - how long until the vehicle is automatically respawned after its crew leaves it (default is -1, i.e., disabled)
		3: NUMBER - number of time the vehicle can be respawned (default is -1, i.e., unlimited)
		4: CODE - code executed upon respawn. Passed arguments are [<newVehicle>,<oldVehicle>]. The old vehicle is deleted only after this code is completed.
		5: POSITION - type of respawn position:
			0 = where it started
			1 = where it was destroyed
			2 = on vehicle's side respawn marker (e.g., "respawn_vehicle_west")
			3 = on BLUFOR respawn marker
			4 = on OPFOR respawn marker
			5 = on Independent respawn marker
			6 = on Civilian respawn marker

	Returns:
	BOOL
*/

bis_fnc_showcuratorfeedbackmessage.title: BIS_fnc_showCuratorFeedbackMessage

Show feedback message when illegal operation is attempted in curator interface.

{! classvalign-top
! stylepadding-right: 2em 
Interface
* 000: Cannot exit Zeus interface
* 003: Cannot move camera outside the camera area
Placing
* 101: Placing objects is not available
* 102: Insufficient resources
* 103: Selected position is not in an editing area
Placing waypoints
* 201: Placing waypoints is not available
* 206: No objects, groups or waypoints selected
Editing
* 301: Editing entities is not available
* 303: Selected position is not inside editing area
* 304: One of the selected entities is not in an editing area
* 307: Players cannot be edited
* 308: The vehicle is full
!
Deleting
* 401: Deleting entities is not available
* 404: One of the selected objects is not in an editing area
* 405: One of selected vehicles has non-editable crew in it
* 407: Players cannot be deleted
 Destroying
* 501: Destroying entities is not available
* 504: One of the selected objects is not in an editing area
* 505: One of the selected vehicles has non-editable crew in it
* 506: No objects selected
* 507: Players cannot be destroyed
Syncing
* 609: At least one AI unit has to be present in synchronization
* 610: Cannot change player side (typo: "changle")
!}

args.name: messageInfo: Number or String - error ID, or text message to be displayed

bis_fnc_initintelobject.title: BIS_fnc_initIntelObject
bis_fnc_initintelobject.description:
This function sets up an object as intel retrievable by the players by adding a "Take Intel" addAction to it.
When a player uses the action, they will play an animation to pick the object up and the object will be deleted from the mission.
The player and any defined recipients will then receive a diary entry which can contain a title, description and picture.
The diary entry will also contain a marker shortcut showing where the intel was found.
This function is similar to placing an intel object as Zeus, but the Zeus interface provides some extra options like:
* Which sides can interact with the action
* The picture, title and description used in the diary entry

When using this function from script there are several variables that need to be set up to acquire the same results (see the examples below).
Without this extra setup the functionality provided is minimal and only includes:
* The "Take Intel" action on the object
* The object can be picked up by a player from any side
* When picked up it will have no title or description and the picture will be a default exclamation mark
* The diary entry will only be given to the person who picked it up

There are some optional features of intel objects that can be used:
* The diary entry's description can be further enhanced by using the supported tags found on the createDiaryRecord page.
* There is also a scripted eventhandler called "IntelObjectFound" that can be registered  on the intel object. The event provides the parameters [object, caller] where object is the intel object and caller the person who picked it up.
* A Zeus who has the intel object registered as a curator editable object can also receive feedback that the intel has been picked up if the scripted eventhandler called "intelObjectFound" was registered on the curator module. The event provides the parameters [zeus, caller, object] where zeus is the curator module, caller the person who picked it up and object is the intel object.
The usage of these scripted event handlers is shown in .

args.name: object
args.desc: object to place intel action on

bis_fnc_initvirtualunit.description: Initialize virtual unit. Disable it, turn the camera upwards and save its correct side.

Init respawn backpack.

	When backpack object has 'respawnNearbyPlayers' attribute set to 1, nearby player will receive the respawn as well.

bis_fnc_respawnrounds.title: BIS_fnc_respawnRounds
bis_fnc_respawnrounds.description:
/*

	Description:
	Disable respawn until players of only one side (including its allies) remains, then respawn everyone at once.
	When "Rounds" respawn is used by only one side, wait until all its players are dead.

	Parameter(s):
		BOOL - true to force round end
		SIDE - use any side to return side affected by round system (based on description.ext respawnTemplates settings)
		ARRAY - empty array to return if a round is still on (players of more than one involved faction are alive)
*/

bis_fnc_genericsentence.title: BIS_fnc_genericSentence

bis_fnc_displaycolorset.title: BIS_fnc_displayColorSet

bis_fnc_displaycolorget.description:
Loads custom color settings from CfgUIDefault.

If variables are not stored in profileNamespace yet, the function will declare them.

 A3

!}

 TKOH

bis_fnc_3dcredits.title: BIS_fnc_3Dcredits
bis_fnc_3dcredits.description: Displays structured text in 3D world. GUI layer for indicator is `2733`.

minDist

args.name: fadeDist

bis_fnc_dirindicator.title: BIS_fnc_dirIndicator
bis_fnc_dirindicator.description:
Show a 4-directions indicator.
Indicator GUI layer is 17, its Display is accessible with  inlineuiNamespace getVariable "BIS_RscMissionScreen_dirIndicator".
Can be reexecuted to change its colour, but once executed this function cannot be halted  until origin's death.

args.name:
target: Code, String, Object or Array format Position - to which indicator points to:
* Code - code result must be Object or Position
* String - missionNamespace variable name
* Object - any object
* Array format Position - any position
color: Array format Color (RGBA) - (Optional, default [0.424,0.651,0.247,1] ( green))

bis_fnc_playvideo.title: BIS_fnc_playVideo
bis_fnc_playvideo.description:
Plays in-game video with a range of options. The function can be called or spawned. If spawned, scriptDone command can be used to see if video is stopped or finished. If called in scheduled environment, the next line of code will not process until the video is stopped or finished.
The function also calls `"BIS_fnc_playVideo_started"` and `"BIS_fnc_playVideo_stopped"` Scripted Event Handlers in missionNamespace - see BIS_fnc_addScriptedEventHandler and Arma 3: Scripted Event Handlers.

syntaxes.code: [content, size, color, skipVarName, bgColor, keepAspect] spawn BIS_fnc_playVideo

args.name: size: Array of Numbers - (Optional, default [safeZoneX, safeZoneY, safeZoneW, safeZoneH]) screen size in format [x, y, w, h]
color: Array of Numbers - (Optional, default [1,1,1,1]) foreground color in format [r, g, b, a]
skipVarName
args.desc: (Optional, default "BIS_fnc_playVideo_skipVideo") missionNamespace variable to skip the video when variable is true

args.name: bgColor: Array format Color (RGBA) - (Optional, default: [0,0,0,1]) background color in format [r, g, b, a]
keepAspect
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true to keep original video aspect ratio (background color will fill the void), false to stretch

bis_fnc_sandstorm.title: BIS_fnc_sandstorm
bis_fnc_sandstorm.description: Creates particle sandstorm round given object.

args.name: brightness

args.name: newspapers

number (Optional): Number of crows - default: areaSize/5
height (Optional): Number - height in which crows flies - default: 30 + random 10

bis_fnc_destroycity.description: Destroys building in given area based on input seed.

* Position
blacklist

bis_fnc_selectrandom.description: Selects one of the arguments at random.

bis_fnc_help.title: BIS_fnc_help
bis_fnc_help.description:
Opens the Functions Viewer which lists all functions defined in:
* Arma 2: Functions Library (Also )
* Arma 3: Functions Library
* Take On Helicopters: Functions Library

File:Fnc_help.jpg and File:Take On Helicopters Functions Viewer.jpgFile:A3 FunctionViewer Overview.png

bis_fnc_recompile.title: BIS_fnc_recompile
bis_fnc_recompile.description: Can be used to recompile functions.

args.name:
mode (Optional, default 0):
* String - name of the function to be recompiled
* Number - can be:
** 0 - Autodetect what compile type should be used
** 1 - Forced recompile of all the things
** 2 - Create only uiNamespace variables (used in UI)
** 3 - Create missionNamespace variables and initialize mission
** 4 - Create only missionNamespace variables
** 5 - Recompile all functions, and initialize mission (used for editor preview with function recompile)

bis_fnc_dirto.title: BIS_fnc_dirTo
bis_fnc_dirto.description: Function which returns vector direction from pos1 to pos2.

args.name: param1 - vector starting point, Position or Object
param2 - vector ending point, Position or Object

bis_fnc_locations.title: BIS_fnc_locations
bis_fnc_locations.description:
Creates or registers location logics (used in various modules, like Ambient Civilians, Ambient Civilian Vehicles or Warfare 2).

Upon registering, function will set following variables into location logic's variable space:
* "class" - unique class of location (either `BIS_loc_<configname>` or `BIS_loc_custom_<ID>`)
* "name" - name of location from config or setName command. If none is defined, class is used
* "type" - config type
* "neighbors" - config defined neighbor locations

If you are registering currently existing object and some of variables above is already stored in it, it will not be replaced.

args.name: types: String or Array of Strings
objects: Array of Objects or Locations - list of specific locations to be registered

bis_fnc_rotatevector2d.title: BIS_fnc_rotateVector2D
bis_fnc_rotatevector2d.description: This function returns a 2D vector rotated a specified number of degrees around the origin.

bis_fnc_spawngroup.title: BIS_fnc_spawnGroup
bis_fnc_spawngroup.description: Function which handles the spawning of a dynamic group of characters.  The composition of the group can be passed to the function.  Alternatively a number can be passed and the function will spawn that amount of characters with a random type.

syntaxes.code: [position, side, toSpawn, relPositions, ranks, skillRange, ammoRange, randomControls, azimuth, precisePos, maxVehicles] call BIS_fnc_spawnGroup

args.name: position: Array format Position - group's starting position

toSpawn - can be one of:
* Array - list of character types
* Number - amount of characters to spawn
* Config - CfgGroups entry
relPositions: Array of Positions (Optional, default  inline[]) a list of relative positions
ranks: Array of Strings/Numbers - (Optional, default  inline[]) ranks (see BIS_fnc_setRank) - must be same size as toSpawn's array
skillRange: Array of Numbers - (Optional, default  inline[]) skill range format [min, max]
ammoRange: Array of Numbers - (Optional, default  inline[]) ammunition range (0..1) format [min, max]

randomControls: Array of Numbers - (Optional, default [-1, 1]) to format [minUnits, chance]:
* minUnits: Number - (Optional, default -1) amount of mandatory units
* chance: Number - (Optional, default -1) spawn chance for remaining units in range 0..1
precisePos
args.desc: (Optional, default true) forces precise position placement

bis_fnc_spawnvehicle.title: BIS_fnc_spawnVehicle
bis_fnc_spawnvehicle.description: Function to spawn a certain vehicle type with all crew (including turrets). The vehicle can either become part of an existing group or create a new group.

args.name: position: Array format Position - desired position
sideOrGroup: Side or Group - side or existing group

bis_fnc_taskpatrol.title: BIS_fnc_taskPatrol
bis_fnc_taskpatrol.description: Create a random patrol of several waypoints around a given position.

args.name: position
args.desc: the position on which to base the patrol

args.name: distance
args.desc: maximum distance between waypoints in meters

bis_fnc_taskdefend.title: BIS_fnc_taskDefend
bis_fnc_taskdefend.description: Group will man nearby static defenses within a 100 metre radius of the defense position and guard the position. Some units will man weapons, others will patrol and the remainder will sit on the ground.

bis_fnc_rsclayer.title: BIS_fnc_rscLayer
bis_fnc_rsclayer.description: Register RSC layer and returns a unique ID.

args.name: layerName
args.desc: layer name. Parent function name is used automatically when param is nil.

bis_fnc_diagkeylayout.title: BIS_fnc_diagKeyLayout
bis_fnc_diagkeylayout.description:
/*

	Description:
	Exports default key layout to wiki template.

	Parameter(s):
	_this select 0: STRING - category, can be one of following
		"" - all controls in game
		"All"
		"BasicInfantryControls"
		"Car"
		"Air"
		"Helicopter"
		"Submarine"
		"Buldozer"
		"UserActions"
	_this select 1: STRING - selection method, can be one of following
		"" - single tap
		"double" - double tap
		"LCtrl" - with left control pressed
		"RCtrl" - with right control pressed
		"LShift" - with left shift pressed
		"RShift" - with right shift pressed

	Returns:
	STRING - wiki export text (also copied to clipboard)
*/

bis_fnc_error.title: BIS_fnc_error
bis_fnc_error.description:
File:BIS_fnc_error.png300
Logs an error message and shows an ingame error message. The message is shown when either of the following is true:

* In 2D Editor
* In Eden Editor via BIS_fnc_3DENNotification
* Display `313` (Eden Editor display) is available
*  inlineprofileNamespace getVariable ["BIS_fnc_init_displayErrors", false] is set to  inlinetrue.

Output format:

* In multiplayer (isMultiplayer) the function will add the profileName in front of the message
* If  inline_fnc_error_exit is set to  inlinetrue before the function call, the log message will display `HALT:` instead of `ERROR:`
* If function is called from within another function, the name of the parent function will be displayed. This can be overwritten by setting  inline_fnc_scriptName to a custom value

args.name: param1..paramN: Anything - (Optional) format arguments, if any

bis_fnc_exportcfgvehicles.title: BIS_fnc_exportCfgVehicles
bis_fnc_exportcfgvehicles.description: Export list of objects for Community Wiki (Assets).

args.name:
mode: String - mode, can be one of:
* "config" - copy the objects table to clipboard
* "screenshots" - create objects one by one and take their screenshot. Works only on "Render" terrain.
* "screenshotsTest" - create objects one by one without taking screen (to verify everything is ok)
sides: Array of Sides - only objects of these sides will be used
classes: Arrayof Strings- list of CfgPatches classes. Only objects belonging to these addons will be used
useAI
args.desc: true to use only AI units (soldiers, vehicles), false to use empty ones

args.name: arguments
args.desc: (Optional, default  inline[]) additional format arguments to fill notification's fields (`title`, `description`, `iconPicture`, `iconText`, `soundRadio`)

syntaxes.code: [classes, duration1, condition1, duration2, condition2, showing, onlyFullHint, onlyOnce, useSound] call BIS_fnc_advHint

args.name: classes
args.desc: array in format ["hint main class", "hint class"]

args.name: duration1
args.desc: (Optional, default 15) duration of short hint in seconds

args.name: condition1
args.desc: (Optional, default "") condition for hiding the short hint

args.name: duration2
args.desc: (Optional, default 35) duration of full hint in seconds

args.name: condition2
args.desc: (Optional, default "") condition for hiding the full hint

args.name: showing
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true shows hint even if tutorial hints are disabled in game settings

args.name: onlyFullHint
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true shows full hint without using of short hint

args.name: onlyOnce
args.desc: (Optional, default false) show the hint in mission only once (true) or multiple times (false)

args.name: useSound
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true plays a sound when the hint is opened

bis_fnc_addcommmenuitem.title: BIS_fnc_addCommMenuItem
bis_fnc_addcommmenuitem.description:
Add communication menu to the given unit.

The item will be available in the Communication menu and visualized in comm menu icon area.

syntaxes.code: [owner, itemClass, textArguments, expressionArguments, notification] call BIS_fnc_addCommMenuItem

args.name: owner
args.desc: object to which the item belongs to

args.name: textArguments
args.desc: (Optional) additional info to display in the `text` attribute. `%1` will be replaced by the first array element, `%2` with the second and so on.

args.name: expressionArguments
args.desc: (Optional) similar to textArguments, just this time in the `expression` attribute.

args.name: notification
args.desc: (Optional) notification class from `CfgNotifications`. Empty string will disabled the notification.

bis_fnc_removecommmenuitem.title: BIS_fnc_removeCommMenuItem
bis_fnc_removecommmenuitem.description: Remove an item from the communication menu.

args.name: owner
args.desc: object to which the item belongs to
