args.desc: item ID returned by BIS_fnc_addCommMenuItem command

returns.desc: true when the item was removed

bis_fnc_loop.title: BIS_fnc_loop
bis_fnc_loop.description: Loop stacked code/function with timing and conditional control. Code and conditions are executed in non-scheduled environment.

args.name:
action: String - can be one of:
* "initialize" - Initializes game loop (not required as internal AUTO_INITIALIZE variable is set to true)
* "terminate" - Terminates game loop (required as internal AUTO_TERMINATE variable is not set to true)
* "itemAdd" - Adds an item to loop
* "itemRemove" - Remove item from loop with id "uniqueId"
* "onEachFrame" - internally used by "initialize"
* "itemExecute" - internally used by "onEachFrame"

parameters: Array - used with "itemAdd" and "itemRemove" action ("itemRemove" only takes id):
* id: String - loop unique id
* code: Code or String - code to be executed
* timer: Number - (Optional, default 0) delay between executions
* timerType: String - (Optional, default "seconds") can be "seconds" or "frames"
* conditionStart: Code - (Optional, default  inline{ true }) will wait until the condition is met to start the code
* conditionEnd:  Code - (Optional, default  inline{ false }) stops the loop as soon as the ending condition is met (after the end of code)
* executeOnce: Boolean - (Optional, default false)

bis_fnc_runlater.title: BIS_fnc_runLater
bis_fnc_runlater.description: Stack code/function that should be run later, after some time/frames or/and custom condition. Internally calls BIS_fnc_loop.

syntaxes.code: [id, code, timer, timerType, condition] call BIS_fnc_runLater

args.name: code: Code or String - code/function that is executed later
timer
args.desc: the timer value (can be in seconds or frames)

args.name: condition
args.desc: the custom condition, code is only executed if timer is validated and condition is met

bis_fnc_buildingpositions.title: BIS_fnc_buildingPositions
bis_fnc_buildingpositions.description: Get all available positions within a building or structure.

bis_fnc_isbuildingenterable.title: BIS_fnc_isBuildingEnterable
bis_fnc_isbuildingenterable.description: Check whether a building or structure has available positions defined within model.

bis_fnc_addstackedeventhandler.title: BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler
bis_fnc_addstackedeventhandler.description:
Stacks an event handler.  All event handlers accept user arguments, which are passed to the EH code in `_this` variable. If the EH has own params returned in `_this` variable as well, user arguments are appended to the end of `_this` array. Note that if you try to add an empty EH, i.e. with empty code, it will simply be ignored.

{! classwikitable
!+ Supported Event Handlers
! Scripted Event Handler
! Mission EH Equivalent
! Description
!-
! "onEachFrame"
! EachFrame
! 
!-
! "onPlayerConnected"
! PlayerConnected
! rowspan2 Special variables `_id`, `_uid`, `_name`, `_jip`, `_owner` are provided and are available in `_this` array as well.
params ["_id", "_uid", "_name", "_jip", "_owner"];
!-
! "onPlayerDisconnected"
! PlayerDisconnected
!-
! "onMapSingleClick"
! MapSingleClick
! Special variables `_units`, `_pos`, `_alt`, `_shift` are provided and are available in `_this` array as well.
params ["_units", "_pos", "_alt", "_shift"];
!-
! "onPreloadStarted"
! PreloadStarted
! 
!-
! "onPreloadFinished"
! PreloadFinished
! 
!}

args.name: id
args.desc: custom id, a unique identifier. Adding same type of EH with the same id will overwrite existing

args.name: event
args.desc: event handler name, see description for supported EHs

args.name: code: Code or String. The String is treated as function name
arguments: Array of Anything - arguments to make available in code in `_this` array

returns.desc: custom id on success or "" on failure

bis_fnc_removestackedeventhandler.title: BIS_fnc_removeStackedEventHandler
bis_fnc_removestackedeventhandler.description: Removes a stacked event handler with specified custom id.

args.name: key
args.desc: custom id, a unique identifier, also returned by BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler

args.name: event
args.desc: event handler name, see BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler fr supported event handlers

returns.desc: true on success, false on failure

bis_fnc_call.title: BIS_fnc_call
bis_fnc_call.description: Execute given code with or without parameter.

bis_fnc_spawn.title: BIS_fnc_spawn
bis_fnc_spawn.description: Execute given code with or without parameter.

bis_fnc_objectvar.title: BIS_fnc_objectVar
bis_fnc_objectvar.description: Return a unique object variable. The variable is preserved after unit respawn.

args.name: varNameRoot
args.desc: (Optional, default "bis_o") - variable name root - a number will be added behind it

bis_fnc_addrespawninventory.title: BIS_fnc_addRespawnInventory
bis_fnc_addrespawninventory.description:
Add a respawn inventory for respawn menu.
Available loadouts are defined in CfgRespawnInventory.

args.name:
target: Receiver of the respawn loadout
* Namespace - use missionNamespace to add the loadout to everyone
* Side
* Group
* Object

inventoryParams: Array or String
* String - CfgRespawnInventory class
* Array - format [class, number, limit]
** class: String - CfgRespawnInventory class
** number: Number - Number of players who can use this inventory (-1 = no limit, default)
** limit: Number - Limit for role assigned to given loadout (-1 = no limit, default) 
*** Only role or only loadout can be limited at one moment, if there is limit for both, then only role uses limit.
*** If the limit definition for role is called multiple times with different numbers, then the highest number is used.

bis_fnc_removerespawninventory.title: BIS_fnc_removeRespawnInventory
bis_fnc_removerespawninventory.description: Remove a respawn inventory added by BIS_fnc_addRespawnInventory.

args.name: target: Namespace, Side, Group or Object

bis_fnc_addrespawnposition.title: BIS_fnc_addRespawnPosition
bis_fnc_addrespawnposition.description: Add a respawn position for the  Respawn Menu.

args.name: target: Namespace, Side, Group or Object - receiver of the respawn position. Use missionNamespace to add the position to everyone

position: Array, Object or String
* Array - format PositionATL
* Object - specific object. When some crew positions are available and unlocked, players will be respawned on them, otherwise they will appear around the object.
* String - marker name
name
args.desc: (Optional) respawn name, can be text or link to localization key

bis_fnc_removerespawnposition.title: BIS_fnc_removeRespawnPosition
bis_fnc_removerespawnposition.description: Remove a respawn position added by BIS_fnc_addRespawnPosition.

args.name: target: Namespace, Side, Group or Object

bis_fnc_respawntickets.title: BIS_fnc_respawnTickets
bis_fnc_respawntickets.description:
Manage respawn tickets used by Tickets respawn template.

When player dies, number of tickets is decreased by 1. The most local tickets are always used. Example: When you first add tickets to player's side, they will be affected. If you later define tickets also to player's group, they will completely replace the side tickets.

When player runs out of the tickets, his respawn is disabled. If you use also EndMission respawn template, the mission will automatically end once tickets in all name spaces are exhausted.

args.name:
target: Receiver of the respawn tickets. Can be of type:
* Namespace - use missionNamespace to set/get global tickets available for everyone
* Side
* Group
* Object
tickets
args.desc: added respawn tickets. When missing or set to 0, number of tickets won't be affected, which means you can use the function to simply get amount of tickets.

args.name: dynamicTarget
args.desc: when true, set/get tickets based on the target. target must be an Object.

returns.desc: remaining tickets in all name spaces

args.name: input: Side or Number - either side or side ID

bis_fnc_settask.title: BIS_fnc_setTask
bis_fnc_settask.description:
Set task parameters.
Create the task when it doesn't exist.

syntaxes.code: [taskId, target, description, (destination, state, priority, showNotification, isGlobal, type, visibleIn3D)] call BIS_fnc_setTask

args.name:
taskId:
String - Task ID
Array -  In the format of [task ID, parent task ID]

target: Task owner(s)
Boolean - true to set task of all playable units
Object - set task of a specific object
Group - set tasks of all objects in the group
Side - set tasks of all objects of the given side
Array - collection of above types

description:
Array - Task description in the format ["description", "title", "marker"]
String - CfgTaskDescriptions class name, if empty string is used then CfgTaskDescriptions is searched for a class matching the tasks TaskID

destination (Optional): Task destination
Object
Array - either position in format [x,y,z], or [object,precision] as used by setSimpleTaskTarget command

state (Optional): Task state
String - can be one of following:
"CREATED"
"ASSIGNED"
"AUTOASSIGNED" ("ASSIGNED" when no task is assigned yet, otherwise "CREATED")
"SUCCEEDED"
"FAILED"
"CANCELED"
Boolean - true to set the task as current
priority (Optional): Number - priority. When a current task is completed, system select a next one with the larges priority >= 0
showNotification (Optional): Boolean - true to show notification (default), false to disable it
isGlobal (Optional): Boolean - true to set task globally (default), false to set it only locally
type (Optional): String - task type from CfgTaskTypes, if not defined, type "" is being used
visibleIn3D (Optional): Boolean - true to make task always visible in 3D (default: false)

bis_fnc_param.title: BIS_fnc_param
bis_fnc_param.description: Load a script parameter. See Arma 3: Functions Library for detailed description.

syntaxes.code: [input, index, defaultValue, dataTypes, requiredCount] call BIS_fnc_param

args.name: defaultValue
args.desc: (Optional, default Nothing) default param (used when param is missing or of wrong type).You can overload default value by declaring variable BIS_fnc_<functionName>_<index> in Namespace where BIS_fnc_param is called from.BIS_fnc_paramIn is a variant of the function with overloading disabled.

args.name: dataTypes
args.desc: (Optional, default Anything) list of allowed type examples (e.g. ["",[],0,objNull])

args.name: requiredCount: Number or Array - (Optional) if value is Array, checks if it has required number of elements

bis_fnc_codeperformance.title: BIS_fnc_codePerformance
bis_fnc_codeperformance.description:
File:BIS_fnc_codePerformance.png300
Measures how much time it takes to execute given expression.
Results may vary based on overall performance; use this function to compare alternative scripting approaches rather than to measure specific values.
Upon function execution, window with results is opened. The user then has a choice to copy the result into clipboard or not.
This function is using diag_codePerformance command.

args.name: arguments
args.desc: (Optional, default  inline[]) arguments to pass into the code

args.name: display
args.desc: (Optional, default  inlinefindDisplay 46) display in which the message window with results will be opened. Use displayNull to disable the window

returns.desc: average execution time of the expression

bis_fnc_endmission.title: BIS_fnc_endMission
bis_fnc_endmission.description: Ends mission with the specified ending. Always ends with a 4 seconds black out effect.

syntaxes.code: [nextMission, endingId, displayText, isSuccess, code] call BIS_fnc_endMission

args.name: displayText
args.desc: (Optional, default "") text displayed on black out

args.name: isSuccess
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true to endMission, false to failMission

args.name: successCode
args.desc: code executed right before mission ends, only if isSuccess is set to true

bis_fnc_mp.title: BIS_fnc_MP
bis_fnc_mp.description: Send function for remote execution (and executes locally if conditions are met).

syntaxes.code: [params, functionName, target, isSpawn, isPersistent] call BIS_fnc_MP

args.name: target
args.desc: (Optional, default everyone) function will be executed only where unit is local

args.name: isSpawn
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true for calling function using 'spawn' command (otherwise 'call' is used)

args.name: isPersistent
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true for persistent call (will be called now and for every JIP client)

bis_fnc_missionflow.title: BIS_fnc_missionFlow
bis_fnc_missionflow.description: This function is automatically run in post-init by a CfgFunctions declaration. If the mission contains a `missionFlow.fsm` file, it will be loaded, otherwise an empty, default one will be used.

bis_fnc_showmissionstatus.title: BIS_fnc_showMissionStatus
bis_fnc_showmissionstatus.description: Show mission status with sectors, respawn tickets, etc.

bis_fnc_setmissionstatusslot.title: BIS_fnc_setMissionStatusSlot
bis_fnc_setmissionstatusslot.description: Set  a slot for mission status with sectors, respawn tickets, etc.

syntaxes.code: [id, text, texture, color, fade, position, barHeight] call BIS_fnc_setMissionStatusSlot

args.name: id: Number  - slot ID. Use -1 to assign it automatically
fade
args.desc: slot fade, 0 is fully visible, 0 hidden

args.name: position: Array in Position format - position top which camera moves after clicking on the slot
barHeight
args.desc: slot progress bar height in range <0;1>

bis_fnc_configextremes.title: BIS_fnc_configExtremes
bis_fnc_configextremes.description:
Scan config paths and return min and max values for each property.
Can be used only for properties of type Number and Array (value is considered to be the geometric mean of all numbers in the array).

args.name: paths: Array of Configs - paths to be scanned.
properties: Array of Strings - class names of properties to be evaluated.
propertyTypes: Array of Booleans - (Optional, default false) whether the property at the respective index should be evaluated and returned as a logarithmic number
propertyDefaults: Array of Numbers - (Optional, default 0) value to be used in cases where the property at the respective index is not defined

returns.desc: [minValues, maxValues] where minValues and maxValues are arrays respective to the properties array.

bis_fnc_didjip.title: BIS_fnc_didJIP
bis_fnc_didjip.description: Return whether or not the local player joined the game while it was already in progress.

bis_fnc_openfieldmanual.title: BIS_fnc_openFieldManual
bis_fnc_openfieldmanual.description:
Opens Field Manual in briefing (SP, MP Server, MP Client) and players's map or journal.
Selects the topic and hint passed as parameters.
Can apply a (search) filter if desired.

args.name: topic
args.desc: class name of a topic that will be selected in the opened Field Manual (e.g. "Damage")

args.name: hint
args.desc: class name of a hint that will be selected in the opened Field Manual (e.g. "HitDamage")

args.name: display
args.desc: (Optional) desired parent Display to open the Field Manual display under

args.name: filter
args.desc: (Optional) pre-filled search field filter in the opened Field Manual (recommended to use localized string)

bis_fnc_unitheadgear.title: BIS_fnc_unitHeadgear
bis_fnc_unitheadgear.description: Randomise headgear and facewear of a character.

args.name:
headgear: Boolean, String or Array - (Optional, default false) can be one of:
* Boolean - if false, change nothing to the headgear
* String - valid Headgear class or a valid class from Description.ext CfgUnitTemplates
* Array - headgear list with individual probability

facewear: Boolean, String or Array - (Optional, default false) can be one of:
* Boolean - if false, change nothing to the facewear
* String - valid facewear class or a valid class from Description.ext CfgUnitTemplates
* Array - facewear list with individual probability

bis_fnc_initvehicle.title: BIS_fnc_initVehicle
bis_fnc_initvehicle.description:
This function changes the textures, animation sources and/or mass of a given vehicle.
Unless explicitly mentioned , the function will restore the initial state of every animation sources of the given object (see ).

args.name:
variant: (Optional, default false)
* Boolean - true to restore default texture source, false to skip texture source change
* Array - texture sources with their probability in format  inline["textureSource1", 0.5, "textureSource2", 0.5]
* String - variant class name - from  inlineconfigFile >> "CfgVehicles" or  inlinemissionConfigFile >> "CfgVehicleTemplates" (see CfgVehicleTemplates)
* Number - index of the texture source (same as the old system)

animations: (Optional, default false)
* Boolean - true to restore init phase of every animation sources
* Array - animation sources with their probability in format  inline["animationSource1", 0.5, "animationSource2", 0.5]
* String - variant class name - from  inlineconfigFile >> "CfgVehicles" or  inlinemissionConfigFile >> "CfgVehicleTemplates" (see CfgVehicleTemplates)

mass: (Optional, default false)
* Boolean - true to set the default mass, false to disable the mass change
* Number - mass to remove/add to the vehicle

bis_fnc_sideisfriendly.title: BIS_fnc_sideIsFriendly
bis_fnc_sideisfriendly.description: Determines if side B is friendly to side A the way the game engine does it. The relationship table can be found here:  Side Relations.

returns.desc: true if side B is friendly to side A.

bis_fnc_sideisenemy.title: BIS_fnc_sideIsEnemy
bis_fnc_sideisenemy.description: Determines if side B is enemy to side A the way the game engine does it. The relationship table can be found here:  Side Relations.

returns.desc: true if side B is enemy to side A.

bis_fnc_netid.title: BIS_fnc_netId
bis_fnc_netid.description: Extends MP-only netId functionality to SP

bis_fnc_objectfromnetid.title: BIS_fnc_objectFromNetId
bis_fnc_objectfromnetid.description: Extends MP-only objectFromNetId functionality to SP

bis_fnc_groupfromnetid.title: BIS_fnc_groupFromNetId
bis_fnc_groupfromnetid.description: Extends MP-only groupFromNetId functionality to SP

bis_fnc_exporteditorpreviews.title: BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews
bis_fnc_exporteditorpreviews.description: Export screenshots of objects for Eden Editor and Community Wiki to `<Arma 3 Profile>\Screenshots\EditorPreviews` directory. See Arma 3 assets.

syntaxes.code: [duration, type, sides, mods, addons, classes] spawn BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews

args.name: duration
args.desc: (Optional, default 1) duration in seconds for which an objects remains on the screen before its screen is captured

args.name:
type: String - (Optional, default "all") can be one of:
* "vehicles" - only characters and vehicles will be used
* "props" - only props will be used
* "all" - all objects will be used
sides: Array of Sides - (Optional, default all sides) list of sides. Only objects of these sides will be used
mods: Array of String - (Optional, default all mods) list of CfgMods classes. Only objects belonging to these mods will be used
addons: Array of String - (Optional, default all addons) list of CfgPatches classes. Only objects belonging to these addons will be used
classes: Array of String - (Optional, default all classes) list of CfgVehicles classes. Only these objects will be used

bis_fnc_taskalwaysvisible.title: BIS_fnc_taskAlwaysVisible
bis_fnc_taskalwaysvisible.description: Returns true if task is forced to be always visible (default: false).

returns.desc: returns true if forced visible, otherwise false

args.name: date: Array  - date in format Date

bis_fnc_exportconfighierarchy.title: BIS_fnc_exportConfigHierarchy
bis_fnc_exportconfighierarchy.description: Export config hierarchy of given config.

bis_fnc_endmissionserver.title: BIS_fnc_endMissionServer
bis_fnc_endmissionserver.description: Ends the mission properly for all players in a multiplayer environment.

args.name:
endType: String - class name of ending defined in CfgDebriefing.
Can be custom or one of dynamically calculated ones:
* "EveryoneWon" - Show "MISSION COMPLETED" to everyone
* "EveryoneLost" - Show "MISSION FAILED" to everyone
* "SideScore" - Show "YOUR SIDE WON" to side with largest score
* "GroupScore" - Show "YOUR GROUP WON" to group with largest score
* "PlayerScore" - Show "YOU WON" to player with largest score

bis_fnc_ambientanim.title: BIS_fnc_ambientAnim
bis_fnc_ambientanim.description: Play set of ambient animations on given unit. If the unit should react to combat, use BIS_fnc_ambientAnimCombat instead.

syntaxes.code: [unit, animationSet, equipmentLevel, snapTo, interpolate, attachToLogic] call BIS_fnc_ambientAnim

args.name: unit
args.desc: unit that will play the animations

args.name:
animationSet: String - the animation set to play. Possible values:
{!
!+ stylecaption-side: bottom  some values are missing due to duplicate results, e.g "STAND" does the same as "STAND1"
!- stylevertical-align: top
!
* STAND1
* STAND2
* STAND_U1
* STAND_U2
* STAND_U3
* WATCH
* WATCH2
* GUARD
* LISTEN_BRIEFING
* LEAN_ON_TABLE
* LEAN
!
* SIT_AT_TABLE
* SIT1
* SIT
* SIT3
* SIT_U1
* SIT_U2
* SIT_U3
* SIT_HIGH1
* SIT_HIGH
* SIT_LOW
* SIT_LOW_U
* SIT_SAD1
* SIT_SAD2
!
* KNEEL
* REPAIR_VEH_PRONE
* REPAIR_VEH_KNEEL
* REPAIR_VEH_STAND
* PRONE_INJURED_U1
* PRONE_INJURED_U2
* PRONE_INJURED
* KNEEL_TREAT
* KNEEL_TREAT2
* BRIEFING
* BRIEFING_POINT_LEFT
* BRIEFING_POINT_RIGHT
* BRIEFING_POINT_TABLE
!}

equipmentLevel: String - the equipment level of the unit. Possible values:
* NONE
* LIGHT
* MEDIUM
* FULL
* ASIS
* RANDOM
snapTo
args.desc: (Optional, default objNull) the object where the unit will be snapped to

args.name: interpolate
args.desc: (Optional, default false) should try to interpolate into the ambient animation. Works only for some default stances

args.name: attachToLogic
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true to attach the unit to the created logic object, forcing it in one position

bis_fnc_removescriptedeventhandler.title: BIS_fnc_removeScriptedEventHandler
bis_fnc_removescriptedeventhandler.description:
Removes scripted event handler with given name and id.
Additionally "ScriptedEventHandlerRemoved" scripted EH is called.

args.name: namespace: Namespace, Object, Group, Location, Boolean, Control or Display - namespace in which handler is saved

returns.desc: true if removed, false if didn't exist

bis_fnc_animateflag.title: BIS_fnc_animateFlag
bis_fnc_animateflag.description: Smoothly animates given flag from current position on the flag pole to the given position. When flag animation is done, the scripted event handler "FlagAnimationDone" is called.

args.name: phase
args.desc: desired animation phase 0...1 (0 - bottom of the flag pole, 1 - top of the flag pole)

args.name:
instant (Optional, default false): 
* Boolean - when true, animation is instant ("FlagAnimationDone" EH is not called in this case)
* Number - animation duration multiplier

bis_fnc_sethitpointdamage.title: BIS_fnc_setHitPointDamage
bis_fnc_sethitpointdamage.description: Sets damage to HitPoint with dependency or not.

args.name: damage:  Number - amount of damage to apply

useDependency: Boolean - (Optional, default true) 
* true - distribute damage to dependent HitPoints as well
* false - apply damage to given HitPoint only

bis_fnc_getarea.title: BIS_fnc_getArea
bis_fnc_getarea.description: Extracts area information from trigger, marker, location or array

args.name:
param:
* Object - trigger
* String - marker
* Location - location
* Array - array in format [center, distance] or [center, [a, b, angle, rect]] or [center, [a, b, angle, rect, height]]

returns.desc: in format [center, a, b, angle, isRectangle, height]

bis_fnc_admin.title: BIS_fnc_admin
bis_fnc_admin.description: Returns the admin state of a client the function is called on. Complements admin script command and used for self check on a local client.

bis_fnc_findallnestedelements.title: BIS_fnc_findAllNestedElements
bis_fnc_findallnestedelements.description: Returns array of paths to all matching elements in deeply nested array, similar to BIS_fnc_findNestedElement but with all occurences.

args.name: target: Position or Object or String - target position, can be object/position 3D or marker name
mag
args.desc: magazine (if left empy, first magazine available will be used)

args.name: radius
args.desc: radius of target area in meters

args.name: rounds
args.desc: number of rounds to be fired

args.name:
delay: Array or Number - delay between rounds:
* Array
** 1: Min delay
** 2: Max delay
* Number - Precise delay
conditionEnd
args.desc: condition to end bombardment before all rounds are fired

args.name: safezone
args.desc: safezone radius - minimal distance from the target position where shells may be directed at

args.name: position: Position, Object or String - can be position, an object, or a marker
ammo
args.desc: (Optional, default "G_40mm_HEDP") ammunition class, nil or empty string to use 40mm HEDP shells

args.name: radius
args.desc: (Optional, default 100) radius of the area in metres

args.name:
rounds: Array - (Optional, default [1,20]) number of rounds to be fired, can be:
* 0: Number of shells
* 1: Number of submunition
delay: Array or Number - (Optional, default 10) delay between rounds in seconds, can be Number for precise delay or Array to set min and max delay
conditionEnd
args.desc: (Optional, default {}) condition to end fire support

args.name: altitude
args.desc: (Optional, default 100) altitude in metres where the submunition will be spawned

args.name: sounds
args.desc: (Optional, default [""]) strings of sounds to be played on the incoming submunition

syntaxes.code: [target, ammo, radius, rounds, delay, conditionEnd, safezone, alt, speed, sounds] spawn BIS_fnc_fireSupportVirtual

args.name: target: Position, Object or String - target position, can be object, position or marker name
ammo
args.desc: (Optional, default "Sh_82mm_AMOS") ammunition to be used (if left empty, `Sh_82mm_AMOS` ammunition will be used)

args.name: radius
args.desc: (Optional, default 100) radius of target area in meters

args.name: rounds
args.desc: (Optional, default 10) number of rounds to be fired

args.name:
delay: Array or Number - (Optional, default 10) delay between rounds
* Array [min, max]:
** min: Number - min delay
** max: Number - max delay
* Number - Precise delay
conditionEnd
args.desc: (Optional, default  inline{ false }) condition to end bombardment before all rounds are fired

args.name: safezone
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) safezone radius - minimal distance from the target position where shells may be directed at

args.name: alt
args.desc: (Optional, default 250) altitude where the shell will be created

args.name: speed
args.desc: (Optional, default 150) descending velocity, in m/s. Default is 150, if you use flare as ammo, set it to lower value (1-5) to let it fall down slowly

args.name: sounds: Array of Strings - (Optional, default [""]) sounds to be played on the incoming shell

bis_fnc_stalk.title: BIS_fnc_stalk
bis_fnc_stalk.description:
Continuously set WP of one group to a different group to hunt it. It does not change the group's behaviour.
Script terminates if one of the groups is eliminated or if the optional condition is activated.

syntaxes.code: [stalker, stalked, refresh, radius, endCondition, endDestination] spawn BIS_fnc_stalk

args.name: stalker
args.desc: the group that will move towards the other

args.name: stalked
args.desc: the group that will be followed

args.name: refresh
args.desc: (Optional, default 10, minimum 5) time between waypoint updates

args.name: endCondition
args.desc: (Optional, default {false}) condition that if true stops stalker to follow stalked

args.name:
endDestination: String or Position or Object or Number - (Optional, default 0) destination stalker will go after endCondition is met (or stalked is killed)
* String - destination marker name
* Position - destination
* Object - destination
* Number
** 0: return to original group waypoints
** 1: search around their current stalking position, in a 50m radius
** 2: return to the original position before stalking

bis_fnc_weaponsentitytype.title: BIS_fnc_weaponsEntityType
bis_fnc_weaponsentitytype.description: Return object's weapons as defined in config. Scans also turrets and pylons.

args.name: class: String or Array of Strings - entity classes

bis_fnc_magazinesentitytype.title: BIS_fnc_magazinesEntityType
bis_fnc_magazinesentitytype.description: Return object's magazines as defined in config. Scans also turrets and pylons.

bis_fnc_getcfg.title: BIS_fnc_getCfg
bis_fnc_getcfg.description:
Smart-return config (extension for BIS_fnc_getCfgXXXX functions).
Can by called 2 ways:
* 1st way - passing config directly
* 2nd way - passing array of strings or config and strings

args.name: input: Config or Array - can be Config path or array of strings with config names

bis_fnc_controlconfigs.title: BIS_fnc_controlConfigs
bis_fnc_controlconfigs.description: Return config paths to all display controls.

bis_fnc_showwelcomescreen.title: BIS_fnc_showWelcomeScreen
bis_fnc_showwelcomescreen.description:
Show welcome screen. Used in the main menu (works fine in Eden Editor).

File:BIS_fnc_showWelcomeScreen.jpg500

args.name: display
args.desc: parent display where welcome screen is to be shown

args.name: forceLatest
args.desc: (Optional, default false) show latest welcome screen automatically

bis_fnc_versioninfo.title: BIS_fnc_versionInfo
bis_fnc_versioninfo.description: Fills the first passed control with game type and version number, and positions both controls according to the game type.

args.name: gameTypeVersionControl - Control - Control for indication of game type (Stable/Dev) and version number (RscText)
modControl - Control - Control for indication of modded game (RscActiveText)

bis_fnc_exportguibaseclasses.title: BIS_fnc_exportGUIBaseClasses
bis_fnc_exportguibaseclasses.description: Export GUI macros and base classes to the clipboard.

args.name:
mode: String - mode, case-sensitive; can be one of:
* `"Default"` - classic base classes like `RscText` or `RscPicture`
* `"3DEN"` - Eden Editor base classes like `ctrlStatic` or `ctrlStaticPicture`
* `"all"` - all GUI base classes, including more exotic ones

returns.desc: `.hpp` file content to be included in Description.ext, also copied to the clipboard

bis_fnc_advhintformat.title: BIS_fnc_advHintFormat
bis_fnc_advhintformat.description: Return formatted texts of a CfgHints hint.

bis_fnc_limitammunition.title: BIS_fnc_limitAmmunition
bis_fnc_limitammunition.description:
Limits the number of magazines carried by individual unit. Each container (uniform, vest and backpack) can be limited separately or left untouched.
	The function limits the number of magazines of each unique ammo category in respective container. Items like First Aid Kit or Mine Detector are not affected by the functionSet the minimum and maximum values in an array, for example [0.5,1] will set the magazine count anywhere between 50-100% of default count.

args.name:
uniformMags: Array - (Optional, default [0.4,0.8]) amount of magazines in uniform. Array in form:
*0:minMags - Minimum amount of magazines in percent (%)
*1:maxMags - Maximum amount of magazines in percent (%)

vestMags: Array - (Optional, default [0.4,0.8]) amount of magazines in vest. Array in form:
*0:minMags - Minimum amount of magazines in percent (%)
*1:maxMags - Maximum amount of magazines in percent (%)

backpackMags: Array - (Optional, default [0.4,0.8]) amount of magazines in backpack. Array in form:
*0:minMags - Minimum amount of magazines in percent (%)
*1:maxMags - Maximum amount of magazines in percent (%)

bis_fnc_limititems.title: BIS_fnc_limitItems
bis_fnc_limititems.description: Keeps or removes unit's items (including NVGs and binocular/designator) based on probability user sets.

syntaxes.code: [unit, chanceNVG, chanceBino, chanceGPS, chanceMap, chanceRadio, chanceCompass, chanceWatch] call BIS_fnc_limitItems

args.name:
chanceNVG: Number - (Optional, default 50) chance to keep NVGs in % (range 0..100)
* 0 = NVGs are always removed
* 100 = NVGs are always kept
chanceBino
args.desc: (Optional, default 50) chance to keep binoculars in %

args.name: chanceGPS
args.desc: (Optional, default 50) chance to keep GPS in %

args.name: chanceMap
args.desc: (Optional, default 50) chance to keep Map in %

args.name: chanceRadio
args.desc: (Optional, default 50) chance to keep radio in %

args.name: chanceCompass
args.desc: (Optional, default 50) chance to keep compass in %

args.name: chanceWatch
args.desc: (Optional, default 50) chance to keep watch in %

bis_fnc_limitweaponitems.title: BIS_fnc_limitWeaponItems
bis_fnc_limitweaponitems.description: Keeps or remove unit's weapon attachments based on probability user sets. Apply for primary, secondary or handgun weapon separately.

syntaxes.code: [unit, mode, chanceOptics, chanceAttach, chanceMuzzle, chanceUnderbarrel] call BIS_fnc_limitWeaponItems

args.name:
mode: Number - (Optional, default 0) can be:
* 1 = primary weapon
* 2 = secondary weapon
* 3 = handgun

chanceOptics: Number or Array in format ["itemClass", chance] - (Optional, default 50) chance to keep optics from 0 to 100%

* if ["itemClassname", number] is used, the function will add that attachment if it passes the check. If not, the current attachment will be removed.
chanceAttach: Number or Array in format ["itemClass", chance] - (Optional, default 50) chance to keep side attachments from 0 to 100%
chanceMuzzle: Number or Array in format ["itemClass", chance] - (Optional, default 50) chance to keep muzzle attachment from 0 to 100%
chanceUnderbarrel: Number or Array in format ["itemClass",chance] - (Optional, default 50) chance to keep underbarrel attachment from 0 to 100%

bis_fnc_disableloading.title: BIS_fnc_disableLoading
bis_fnc_disableloading.description: Disables the load/restart button. Currently only for BIS_fnc_cinemaBorder used within the Prologue and Survive campaigns. Only works in single player.

bis_fnc_gridtopos.title: BIS_fnc_gridToPos
bis_fnc_gridtopos.description: Converts grid coordinates to world position.

args.name: gridPosition
args.desc: (Optional, default  inlinemapGridPosition position cameraOn) accepts both "024577" or "De82" format

bis_fnc_encodeflags.title: BIS_fnc_encodeFlags
bis_fnc_encodeflags.description: Encodes array of unique binary flags with indexes between 0-15 into a single scalar.

args.name: flags
args.desc: array of unique binary flags with indexes between 0-15

bis_fnc_decodeflags.title: BIS_fnc_decodeFlags
bis_fnc_decodeflags.description: Decodes a single scalar into array of unique binary flags with indexes between 0-15.

bis_fnc_deletecounter.title: BIS_fnc_deleteCounter
bis_fnc_deletecounter.description:
/*
	Author: 
		Killzone_Kid

		Delete given counter

	Parameter(s):

			STRING - variable name of counter
			ARRAY in format [variableName,nameSpace], where nameSpace can be object, group or missionNameSpace/uiNameSpace
	Returns:

*/

#define VAR_SPACES [currentNamespace, objNull, displayNull, controlNull, grpNull, locationNull, taskNull, teamMemberNull]

bis_fnc_deletevehiclecrew.title: BIS_fnc_deleteVehicleCrew
bis_fnc_deletevehiclecrew.description: Deletes specific crew member directly from the vehicle.

syntaxes.code: [object, face, speaker, pitch, callsign] call BIS_fnc_setIdentity

args.name: pitch
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) speaker pitch (1 is unchanged pitch)

args.name:
rotation: Array - vector in format:
# Yaw

# Roll

bis_fnc_cargoturretindex.title: BIS_fnc_cargoTurretIndex
bis_fnc_cargoturretindex.description: Return cargo index of a person turret and the other way around.

args.name: personOrTurretPath: Person or Array of Numbers - unit to find or turret path

bis_fnc_storeparamsvalues.title: BIS_fnc_storeParamsValues
bis_fnc_storeparamsvalues.description: Parses mission params and stores them into public variable "BIS_fnc_storeParamsValues_data". Use BIS_fnc_getParamValue to retrieve params values from the variable.

bis_fnc_paramreviveunconsciousstatemode.title: BIS_fnc_paramReviveUnconsciousStateMode

bis_fnc_initlistnboxsorting.title: BIS_fnc_initListNBoxSorting
bis_fnc_initlistnboxsorting.description:
File:A3_BIS_fnc_initListNBoxSorting_example.jpgA GUI using BIS_fnc_initListNBoxSorting
Automatically creates buttons and sets them up so they can be used to sort a CT_LISTNBOX. The buttons will automatically be resized to fit the column width of ctrlFilter.

By default, the ctrlContent columns are sorted by lnbText (using lnbSort). If a specific column should be sorted by lnbValue (using lnbSortByValue) instead, then something needs to be set in the data of the corresponding ctrlFilter column (literally something, the condition in the source code is  inline(_ctrlFilter lnbData [0, _i]) != "").

Regarding ctrlFilter:
* The position and size of this control define where the buttons for sorting are created, thus it should be placed above ctrlContent and its columns should have the same size as the columns of ctrlContent.
* The text set in the columns is displayed as text for the buttons (the buttons are actually transparent).
* The control can also be part of a CT_CONTROLS_GROUP. If that is the case, the buttons will be created as children of that group.
* To keep a uniform style between vanilla and custom controls it is recommended to create a background with CT_STATIC behind ctrlFilter with  langcpp inlinecolorBackground[] = { 0, 0, 0, 1 };.
See  for a full example including a config.

args.name: ctrlFilter
args.desc: dummy CT_LISTNBOX control used for setting up the filter.

args.name: ctrlContent
args.desc: the CT_LISTNBOX which actually contains the sortable content.

args.name: columnIndexes: Array of Numbers - (Optional, default: []) these are the column indexes of ctrlContent which should be sortable. An empty array means all columns are sortable.
idc
args.desc: (Optional, default: 200) used to assign IDCs to the buttons created by this function. The first button has idc, the second button has idc + 1 and so on.

bis_fnc_carrier01init.title: BIS_fnc_carrier01Init
bis_fnc_carrier01init.description:
This is a main function designed to assemble a dynamic aircraft carrier.
A carrier consists of multiple sub-objects that are linked together based on precise memory point positions in 3D space.

args.name: carrier
args.desc: an object from which the script will wait to get variable "BIS_carrierParts"

bis_fnc_carrier01posupdate.title: BIS_fnc_carrier01PosUpdate
bis_fnc_carrier01posupdate.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is a sub function designed to update dynamic aircraft carriers position in EDEN editor. Carrier consists of multiple sub-objects that are linked together bnased on precise memory point positions in 3D space.
	Function will update initial object positions when player drggs the object in EDEN editor.

	Exucution:
	- Call from EH on the main carrier base model (blank model with momory points and reference config).

		Example:
		class Eventhandlers
		{
			init = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01Init";								//main init fnc, will assemble carrier in game
			AttributesChanged3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenInit";			//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			Dragged3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01PosUpdate";					//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			RegisteredToWorld3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenInit";			//initial EDEN init fnc (main init is still called)
			UnregisteredFromWorld3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenDelete";	//function  to delete all carrier objects in EDEN editor
		};

	Requirments:
	- An array of carrier parts/objects as a variable attached to main carrier base. This array is created by main BIS_fnc_Carrier01Init.

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: carrier Base/object
		and
		1: array of objects in variable in base objects namespace ["bis_carrierParts", []];

	Returns: nothing
	Result: Aircraft Carrier's possition is updated in EDEN editor.

*/

bis_fnc_carrier01edeninit.title: BIS_fnc_carrier01EdenInit
bis_fnc_carrier01edeninit.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is a sub function designed to assemble dynamic aircrfat carrier in EDEN editor. Carrier consists of multiple sub-objects that are linked together bnased on precise memory point positions in 3D space.
	Function will update initial init setup on EDEN editor invoked.

	Exucution:
	- Call from EH on the main carrier base model (blank model with momory points and reference config).

		Example:
		class Eventhandlers
		{
			init = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01Init";								//main init fnc, will assemble carrier in game
			AttributesChanged3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenInit";			//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			Dragged3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01PosUpdate";					//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			RegisteredToWorld3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenInit";			//initial EDEN init fnc (main init is still called)
			UnregisteredFromWorld3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenDelete";	//function  to delete all carrier objects in EDEN editor
		};

	Requirments:
	- An array of carrier parts/objects as a variable attached to main carrier base. This array is created by main BIS_fnc_Carrier01Init.

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: carrier Base/object
		and
		1: array of objects in variable in base objects namespace ["bis_carrierParts", []];

	Returns: nothing
	Result: Aircraft Carrier's possition is updated in EDEN editor.

*/

bis_fnc_carrier01edendelete.title: BIS_fnc_carrier01EdenDelete
bis_fnc_carrier01edendelete.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is a sub function designed to delete dynamic aircrfat carrier in EDEN editor. Carrier consists of multiple sub-objects that are linked together bnased on precise memory point positions in 3D space.
	Function will delete carrier parts in EDEN editor after main object is deleted.

	Exucution:
	- Call from EH on the main carrier base model (blank model with momory points and reference config).

		Example:
		class Eventhandlers
		{
			init = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01Init";								//main init fnc, will assemble carrier in game
			AttributesChanged3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenInit";			//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			Dragged3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01PosUpdate";					//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			RegisteredToWorld3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenInit";			//initial EDEN init fnc (main init is still called)
			UnregisteredFromWorld3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenDelete";	//function  to delete all carrier objects in EDEN editor
		};

	Requirments:
	- An array of carrier parts/objects as a variable attached to main carrier base. This array is created by main BIS_fnc_Carrier01Init.

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: carrier Base/object
		and
		1: array of objects in variable in base objects namespace ["bis_carrierParts", []];

	Returns: nothing
	Result: Aircraft Carrier's parts are deleted in EDEN editor.

*/

/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This function is designed as part of set of functions to implement semi-authenthic ejection system on fixed wing aircrfat that have such functionality enabled/configured.
	- AI behaviour handler.

	Exucution:
	- Call the function via attached EH to the aircrfat itself.

		Example:
		class Eventhandlers : Eventhandlers
		{
			Hit = "_this call BIS_fnc_planeAiEject";
		};

	- Compatible aircrfat must have a config definition for all subsytems that will be invoked by ejection system (see BIS_fnc_PlaneEjection).

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: plane/object

	Returns: nothing
	Result: AI pilot will be forced to eject from aircrfat upon damage treshold reached. Semi-authenthic behaviour.

*/

args.name: personTurrets
args.desc: true to include FFV (firing from vehicle) turrets, false to exclude them

bis_fnc_drawarrow.title: BIS_fnc_drawArrow
bis_fnc_drawarrow.description: Draws a static arrow (outline or color filled) on map. See  for arrow removal.

syntaxes.code: [from, to, color, pars, fill, map] call BIS_fnc_drawArrow

args.name: from
args.desc: arrow start position in format [x,y] or [x,y,z]

args.name: to
args.desc: arrow end position in format [x,y] or [x,y,z]

args.name: color: Array format Color (RGBA) - (Optional, default [1,1,1,1]) arrow line or fill color

pars: Array - (Optional) arrow geometry details in format [arrowThickness, arrowHeadLengthCoef, arrowHeadWidthCoef], where:
* arrowThickness: Number - (Optional, default 10) arrow thickness in meters
* arrowHeadLengthCoef:  Number - (Optional, default 1/3) arrow head length compared to the total length of the arrow
* arrowHeadWidthCoef:  Number - (Optional, default 2) arrow head width compared to the arrow thickness
*  arrowBaseWidthCoef: Number - (Optional, default 1) arrow base width compared to the arrow thickness
fill
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true to draw color filled arrow, false to draw outline

bis_fnc_fire.title: BIS_fnc_fire
bis_fnc_fire.description: Makes a unit or a vehicle fire given muzzle. Make sure that there is some ammo to fire, and, in case of a unit, the weapon with given muzzle is already selected. It can be used to fire pretty much any muzzle on unit or vehicle from anywhere. Available weapons could usually be found with weapons, weaponsTurret and allTurrets commands.

args.name: muzzle
args.desc: muzzle name of the muzzle to fire

args.name: turret
args.desc: (Optional) turret path of the turret with given muzzle (vehicles only)

args.name: mode
args.desc: "init" for scripted initialization, other modes are used when leaflets are fired as a weapon

args.name:
parameters: Array to format:
* [leaflet, texture, text]
** leaflet: Object - the leaflet object itself
** texture: String - texture path
** text: String - localized text, shown when previewing the leaflet in full screen
* [leaflet, cfgLeafletsClass]
** leaflet: Object - the leaflet object itself
** cfgLeafletsClass: String - class name as string

bis_fnc_getcloudletparams.title: BIS_fnc_getCloudletParams
bis_fnc_getcloudletparams.description: Return particle params of CfgCloudlets class.

bis_fnc_createruin.title: BIS_fnc_createRuin
bis_fnc_createruin.description: Create a building ruin and hide the original object.

args.name:
arrayOfArrays: array of arrays; each subarray defines part of an article, can be:
* Article title: ["title", <text:string>]
* Article author and date: ["meta", [<author:string>, <date:array Y,M,D,H,M>, <timezoneName:string>]]
* Paragraph: ["text",<text:string>]
* Bold paragraph: ["textbold",<text:string>]
* Locked paragraph: ["textlocked",[<text:string>,<prompt:string>]] - Locked paragraph with subscriber prompt. There should be no paragraph after it.
* Image with description: ["image", [<path:string>, <description:string>, <source:string>]] - The image should have 2:1 ratio.
* Link to another "fake" article displayed on left: ["box",[<path:string>, <description:string>]] - The image should have 2:1 ratio.
* Author's bio: ["author",[<path:string>, <description:string>]] - The image should have 1:1 ratio.
* Draft notification: ["draft",[<text:string>, <color:arrayRGB>]] - Text and color are optional, default notification will be shown when they're undefined.
display
args.desc: a display to make the AAN article a child of it

args.name: fade
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to fade from black

bis_fnc_firedbombdemine.title: BIS_fnc_firedBombDemine
bis_fnc_firedbombdemine.description: Function used inside the IDAP showcase.

args.name:
mode: String - can be one of:

bis_fnc_smoothstep.title: BIS_fnc_smoothStep
bis_fnc_smoothstep.description: Interpolates between 0 and 1 with smoothing at the limits. Formula is `n2 × (3 - 2n)`.

args.name: number
args.desc: a number in range 0..1. A value not in range will be floored to 0 or ceiled to 1

bis_fnc_initinspectable.title: BIS_fnc_initInspectable
bis_fnc_initinspectable.description: Initialize inspectable object: add "Inspect" action to the object. When a player activates it, full-screen detail of the objects is shown.

args.name: inspectable
args.desc: object on which the action is added

args.name:
textureInfos: can be one of the following:
* String - texture path
* Array - [texture, index, aspectRatio]:
** texture: String - texture path
** index: Number - (Optional, default 0) index on which the texture will be mapped on the object using setObjectTexture. Use -1 to ignore.
** aspectRatio: Number - (Optional, default -1) texture aspect ratio. 0.5 means width will be 0.5 of the height. -1 means texture default.
* Boolean - true to instantly show the inspectable full-screen preview (following params are then ignored)
fullScreenText
args.desc: text to be shown after clicking on READ button. Ideally localized.

args.name: soundName
args.desc: sound played when entering full-screen preview. Sould be defined in CfgSounds.

bis_fnc_wpdemine.title: BIS_fnc_wpDemine
bis_fnc_wpdemine.description:
Scripted "CLEAR MINES" Advanced Waypoint.
The script needs a unit with the abiility to demine (engineer or explosive specialist trait and a toolkit).

args.desc: a group with a mine expert

args.desc: the demining centre. Demining radius is defined by waypointCompletionRadius, and defaults to 50 if set to 0

args.name: clearUnknownMines
args.desc: (Optional, default true) should the group demine all mines or only the one its side knows about

bis_fnc_mapsize.description: Returns map size from config. Do not confuse with worldSize. The engine command calculates the map size and doesn't read it from config.

Can be one of the following:

bis_fnc_objectsgrabber.title: BIS_fnc_objectsGrabber
bis_fnc_objectsgrabber.description:
Converts a set of placed objects to an object array (as a String) for the DynO mapper.
Format is the following. First, the header:

/*
Grab data:
Mission: TheMissionName
World: Stratis
Anchor position: [3781.59, 3289.67]
Area size: 50
Using orientation of objects: yes/no
*/


Then, data:

[
	["B_UAV_01_F",[-5.23706,-0.183594,-0.00126648],167.39,1,0,[0.605018,-0.575293],"","",true,false], 
	["C_Offroad_01_F",[-4.25903,4.62158,0.0630951],224.14,1,0,[0.812812,0.190543],"","",true,false]
]


or, if object orientation is not used:

[
	["B_UAV_01_F",[-5.23706,-0.183594,-0.00126648],167.39,1,0,[],"","",true,false], 
	["C_Offroad_01_F",[-4.25903,4.62158,0.0630951],224.14,1,0,[],"","",true,false]
]

args.name: position
args.desc: (Optional, default [0,0]) 2D or 3D position, center of the "grabbing" area

args.name: objectOrientation
args.desc: (Optional, default false) capture object orientation or not. Format BIS_fnc_getPitchBank

bis_fnc_initdisplay.title: BIS_fnc_initDisplay
bis_fnc_initdisplay.description: This function is a central part of how BI handles UIs. For a full explanation see this page.

args.name:
parameters: Array
* [] - Init displays during preStart
* [mode, params, displayClass, scriptPath, register]
** mode: String -  Mode, can be "onLoad" or "onUnload"
** params: Array - Parameters passed from onLoad or onUnload UI event handler
** displayClass: String - Display class, usually to format "RscDisplayXXX"
** scriptPath: String - Script path from CfgScriptPaths
** register: Number or Boolean - Save variables associated with the display to the uiNamespace. Usually this is `false` when the function is called from a control.

bis_fnc_holdactionadd.title: BIS_fnc_holdActionAdd

syntaxes.code: [target, title, idleIcon, progressIcon, conditionShow, conditionProgress, codeStart, codeProgress, codeCompleted, codeInterrupted, arguments, duration, priority, removeCompleted, showUnconscious, showWindow] call BIS_fnc_holdActionAdd

args.name: target
args.desc: object the action is attached to

args.name: title
args.desc: title of the action shown in the action menu.It can contain Structured Text tags, such as  langhtml inline<t color='#FFAA00'>text</t>

args.name: idleIcon
args.desc: (Optional, default "\A3\Ui_f\data\IGUI\Cfg\HoldActions\holdAction_revive_ca.paa") path of the idle icon shown on screen

args.name: progressIcon
args.desc: (Optional, default "\A3\Ui_f\data\IGUI\Cfg\HoldActions\holdAction_revive_ca.paa") path of the progress icon shown on screen

args.name:
conditionShow: String - (Optional, default "true") condition for the action to be shown.
Special arguments passed to the code: `_target` (action-attached object), `_this` (caller/executing unit)

conditionProgress: String - (Optional, default "true") condition for the action to progress; if false is returned action progress is paused.
Special arguments passed to the code: `_target`, `_caller`, `_actionId`, `_arguments`

codeStart: Code - (Optional, default  inline{}) code executed when action starts.
Special arguments passed to the code: `_target`, `_caller`, `_actionId`, `_arguments`
Passed arguments are:
params ["_target", "_caller", "_actionId", "_arguments"];
* target: Object - the object which the action is assigned to
* caller: Object - the unit that activated the action
* actionId: Number - ID of the activated action (same as ID returned by addAction)
* arguments: Array - arguments given to the function

codeProgress: Code - (Optional, default  inline{}) code executed on every progress tick.
Special arguments passed to the code: `_target`, `_caller`, `_actionId`, `_arguments`, `_frame`
Passed arguments are:
params ["_target", "_caller", "_actionId", "_arguments", "_frame", "_maxFrame"];
* target: Object - the object which the action is assigned to
* caller: Object - the unit that activated the action
* actionId: Number - ID of the activated action (same as ID returned by addAction)
* arguments: Array - arguments given to the function
* frame: Number - current progress, goes from 1 to 24
* maxFrame: Number - maximum progress (24)

codeCompleted: Code - (Optional, default  inline{}) code executed on completion.
Special arguments passed to the code: `_target`, `_caller`, `_actionId`, `_arguments`
Passed arguments are:
params ["_target", "_caller", "_actionId", "_arguments"]; // same as codeStart

codeInterrupted: Code - (Optional, default  inline{}) code executed on interrupted.
Special arguments passed to the code: `_target`, `_caller`, `_actionId`, `_arguments`
Passed arguments are:
params ["_target", "_caller", "_actionId", "_arguments"]; // same as codeCompleted

arguments: Array - (Optional, default  inline[]) arguments passed to codeStart, codeProgress, codeCompleted and codeInterrupted (max 10) in format:

params [
	"_a0", "_a1", "_a2", "_a3", "_a4", "_a5", "_a6", "_a7", "_a8", "_a9", // custom arguments
	"_target", "_title", "_iconIdle", "_iconProgress",
	"_condShow", "_condProgress", "_codeStart", "_codeProgress", "_codeCompleted", "_codeInterrupted",
	"_duration", "_removeCompleted"
];
duration
args.desc: (Optional, default 10) action duration, i.e. how much time it takes to complete the action

args.name: priority
args.desc: (Optional, default 1000) priority value; actions are arranged in descending order according to this value

args.name: showUnconscious
args.desc: (Optional, default false) show in unconscious state

args.name: showWindow
args.desc: (Optional, default true) show on screen; if false action needs to be selected from action menu to appear on screen

bis_fnc_priorityqueue_init.title: BIS_fnc_priorityQueue_Init
bis_fnc_priorityqueue_init.description:
/*
	Author: Zozo

	Description:
	Initialize the Priority Queue data structure.
	The Priority Queue is sorted on inserting. Bigger numbers are set on higher indexes.

	Parameters:
	_maxSize:INT - OPTIONAL, sets the Queue MAX SIZE (otherwise it is set to the constant defined in the .inc file)

	Returns:
	_handle: Handle to the Queue (essential for manipulation with the Queue)

	Syntax:
	_handle:INT = [_maxSize] call BIS_fnc_PriorityQueue_Init;

	Example:
	_priorityQueue_1 = [10] call BIS_fnc_PriorityQueue_Init;
* Remove this after fill-in

bis_fnc_priorityqueue_pushitem.title: BIS_fnc_priorityQueue_PushItem
bis_fnc_priorityqueue_pushitem.description:
/*
	Author: Zozo

	Description:
	Inserts item with a defined priority to the Queue
	The Priority Queue is sorted on inserting. Bigger numbers are set on higher indexes.
	Complexity: O(n)

	Parameters:
	_handle:INT - Queue handle (get it with BIS_fnc_PriorityQueue_Init)
	_item:ANY - item, can be whatever
	_priority:INT - the priority the item is inserted with

	Returns:
	_success:BOOL - true if item was inserted into the Queue, otherwise false

	Syntax:
	_success:BOOL = [_handle, _item, _priority] call BIS_fnc_PriorityQueue_InsertItem;

	Example:
	_s = [_priorityQueue_1, "myItem", 5] call BIS_fnc_PriorityQueue_InsertItem;
* Remove this after fill-in

bis_fnc_priorityqueue_popitem.title: BIS_fnc_priorityQueue_PopItem
bis_fnc_priorityqueue_popitem.description:
/*
	Author: Zozo

	Description:
	Pops the item with the highest priority from the Queue (item with highest index).
	The item is removed from the Queue.
	Complexity: O(1)

	Parameters:
	_handle:INT - Queue handle (get it with BIS_fnc_PriorityQueue_Init)
	_keep:BOOL - if true, the item is not removed from the Queue

	Returns:
	_item:ANY - the item stored in the Queue

	Syntax:
	_item:ANY = [_handle] call BIS_fnc_PriorityQueue_PopItem;

	Example:
	_myItem = [_priorityQueue_1] call BIS_fnc_PriorityQueue_PopItem;
* Remove this after fill-in

bis_fnc_priorityqueue_isempty.title: BIS_fnc_priorityQueue_IsEmpty
bis_fnc_priorityqueue_isempty.description:

bis_fnc_diagmacrossimpleobject.title: BIS_fnc_diagMacrosSimpleObject
bis_fnc_diagmacrossimpleobject.description:
/*
	Generates simple object config data.

	Parameters:
		0: OBJECT or ARRAY - ground position where ground objects will be created (default: position calculated 15 meters away from player)
		1: SCALAR or BOOL - autolog mode (default: false)
			0 or false - no autolog, results will be only stored in clipboard
			1 or true - autolog on, results will be stored in \A3\macros_CfgVehicles_simpleObject_auto_A3.hpp file.
			2 - autlog on + world name, random number and custom suffix are appended to name of generated file to prevent overwriting and provide extra info
		2: ARRAY - classes you want to scan, use [] to scan all (default: []).
		3: OBJECT or ARRAY - sea position where ground objects will be created (default: position calculated 15 meters away from player)
		4: STRING - custom suffix added to filename if autolog is used (default: "").

	Example:
	bis_scriptHandle = [] spawn BIS_fnc_diagMacrosSimpleObject;

	Expected output per class (animate and hide arrays can have varying amount of elements):
	#define CFGVEHICLES_SIMPLEOBJECT_class_F\
		class SimpleObject\
		{\
			animate[] =\
			{\
				{"animationName1", 1},\
				{"animationName2", 2}\
			};\
			hide[] =\
			{\
				"animationSelection1",\
				"animationSelection2"\
			};\
			verticalOffsetAsl = 0;\
		};
*/ Remove this after fill-in

bis_fnc_encodeflags4.title: BIS_fnc_encodeFlags4
bis_fnc_encodeflags4.description:
/*
	Encodes array of unique 4-state flags (0,1,2,3) into a single number.

	Syntax:
	-------
	_encodedFlags:scalar = _flags:array call BIS_fnc_encodeFlags4;

	Example:
	--------
	225 = [1,0,2,3] call BIS_fnc_encodeFlags4;

	Explanation:
	------------
	[1,0,2,3] -> 11 10 00 01 -> 225
	[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1] -> 01 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 -> 0100 0000 0000 0000 -> 16384
*/ Remove this after fill-in

bis_fnc_decodeflags8.title: BIS_fnc_decodeFlags8

bis_fnc_encodeflags8.title: BIS_fnc_encodeFlags8
bis_fnc_encodeflags8.description:
/*
	Encodes array of unique 8-state flags (0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7) into a single number.

	Syntax:
	-------
	_encodedFlags:scalar = _flags:array call BIS_fnc_encodeFlags8;

	Example:
	--------
	4311 = [7,2,3,0,1] call BIS_fnc_encodeFlags8;

	Explanation:
	------------
	[7,2,3,0,1] -> 001 000 011 010 111 -> 0001 0000 1101 0111 -> 4311
*/ Remove this after fill-in

bis_fnc_encodeflags2.title: BIS_fnc_encodeFlags2
bis_fnc_encodeflags2.description: Encodes array of unique binary flags (zeroes or ones) into a single scalar.

bis_fnc_synchronizedobjectsqueue.title: BIS_fnc_synchronizedObjectsQueue
bis_fnc_synchronizedobjectsqueue.description:
/*
	Author: Jiri Wainar

	Description:
	Return sequence of all synchronized objects forming either line or circle.

	Parameter(s):
		0: OBJECT - starting object
		1: STRING or ARRAY of STRINGs (Optional) - object types that are considered
		2: BOOL (Optional) - class filter uses exact match
			true (default): objects need to match exectly one of the filter classes
			false: exact match is not required, objects can inherit from one of the listed classes
		3: NUMBER (Optional) - expected connection shape
			0 (default): none, can be either line or circle
			1: line expected
			2: circle expected

	Returns:
	ARRAY of OBJECTs or empty ARRAY if error is encountered

	Errors:
		* There are more then 2 objects matching class filter connected.
		* Circle is required but closing connection is not detected.

	Example:
	[_start,["ModuleToWAreaVertex_F","ModuleToWAreaOptions_F"],true,0] call BIS_fnc_synchronizedObjectsQueue;
*/ Remove this after fill-in

args.name: duration

args.name: fadeTime
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) time in seconds after which cancel marker fades. If value is <0 then marker won't fade out and will be deleted after duration

args.name: sizeMultiplier
args.desc: (Optional, default 1) multiplier for a size of the 'cancel' marker compared to the original

args.name: angleOffset
args.desc: (Optional, default 45) angle offset from the original marker

bis_fnc_shakemapeh.description:
/*
	Author: Riccardo Argiolas

	Description:
		Event handler function for the shakeMap.sqf function

	Parameters:
	Select 0 - NUMBER: duration of shake effect.
	Select 1 - NUMBER: magnitude of the shaking force.
	Select 2 - ARRAY: position of the camera center around which the shake effect occurs.
	Select 3 - NUMBER: starting shake time (i.e. time elapsed since mission started till the start of the shake animation).

	Returns: None

	Examples:

		private _shakeEventCode = format ["[%1, %2, %3, %4] call BIS_fnc_drawMapShake", _shakeDuration, _shakeMagnitude, _shakeCenter, time];
		BIS_shakeEventHandler = _map ctrladdeventhandler ["draw",_shakeEventCode];
*/ Remove this after fill-in

bis_fnc_getmarkers.title: BIS_fnc_getMarkers
bis_fnc_getmarkers.description: Returns markers in format PREFIX_N where PREFIX_ is the provided argument and N is an integer between 1 and 128. If there are 128 markers but marker 123 is missing, then only the first 122 marker will be returned.

bis_fnc_shakemap.title: BIS_fnc_shakeMap
bis_fnc_shakemap.description: "Camera shake" function for the map. Shakes the map for a given amount of time with a given amount of force around the given camera center. Exits if map is not open.

bis_fnc_getbordermarkers.title: BIS_fnc_getBorderMarkers
bis_fnc_getbordermarkers.description: Retrieves marker names used in the border restrictions module.

bis_fnc_eventtimeline.title: BIS_fnc_eventTimeline
bis_fnc_eventtimeline.description: Universal system for playing sequential events defined by time.

syntaxes.code: [timeline, index, music, codeInterrupt, codeEnd] call BIS_fnc_eventTimeline

args.name: index
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) index of the event to play

args.name: music
args.desc: (Optional, default "") music to be played which will provide the sync time for the timeline

args.name:
codeInterrupt: Code - (Optional, default 
 inlineparams ["_pointer", "_baseTime", "_evenTime"];
["Timeline interrupted while playing event nr.: %1 (%2)", _pointer, _baseTime + _eventTime] call BIS_fnc_logFormat;)Code to be executed if the timeline is interrupted with 
 inlinemissionNamespace setVariable ["BIS_fnc_eventTimeline_playing", false]
codeEnd: Array or Code - (Optional, default nil) Code or Array of codes to be executed once the timeline is finished. The codes are called one after the other.

bis_fnc_zoomlock.title: BIS_fnc_zoomLock
bis_fnc_zoomlock.description: Locks the camera in place when the map is open.

args.name: cameraCenter: Array format Position2D - (Optional, default [0, 0]) position where the camera should be placed and locked

bis_fnc_missionselector.title: BIS_fnc_missionSelector
bis_fnc_missionselector.description: Function that draws clickable, hoverable and animated icons on the map that execute a user-defined code when pressed.

args.name: area: Array of Number - (Optional, default [100,100]) used to determine map's zoom, format [width, height]
mapCenter
args.desc: (Optional, default [0,0]) center position where the map camera will be positioned

args.name:
missionsArray: Array - (Optional, default  inline[]) list of selectable missions and their parameters, to format [pos, text, tooltip, picture, code]:
* pos: Array - where the clickable marker will be placed
* text: String - text that should be displayed next to the icon
* tooltip: String - text to be displayed in the tooltip (on mouse over)
* picture: String - location of the picture to be displayed in the tooltip
* code: Code - code spawned when the icon is clicked

bis_fnc_createtooltip.title: BIS_fnc_createTooltip
bis_fnc_createtooltip.description:
Shows group tooltip. Adapted for Tac Ops DLC for use in the animated briefings.

File:a3 bis fnc createTooltip.jpg300

args.name:
input: Array format [config, parameters]:
* config: Config - group from CfgORBAT
* parameters: Array - group params returned by BIS_fnc_ORBATGetGroupParams
display
args.desc: display where tooltip controls group is created

bis_fnc_scaleandtranslate.title: BIS_fnc_scaleAndTranslate
bis_fnc_scaleandtranslate.description:
/*
	Author: Riccardo Argiolas

	Description:
		Translates and scales (with pivot) and fades a picture over time.

	Parameters:
	Select 0 - CONTROL: picture that has to be modified
	Select 1 - NUMBER: how much the picture has to be scaled (>1 makes it bigger, 1 keeps it the same, <1 makes it smaller)
	Select 2 - STRING: select the pivot's position (i.e. center of the scaling process)
	Select 3 - ARRAY: how much the picture has to be translated/moved in [X,Y] format
	Select 4 - NUMBER: either the duration of the animation(default) or the speed of the translation, depending on what the next parameter is set to.
	Select 5 - BOOL: true = duration will be used, false = speed will be used.
	Select 6 - NUMBER: transparency of the image at the end of the animation (1 = invisible)

	Returns: 
	NUMBER: Duration of the animation. (Useful for determining how much sleep time is needed between animations)

	Examples:
	[_controlFront, 0.8, "topLeft"] call BIS_fnc_scaleAndTranslate;
	_t = [_controlFront, 1, "bottomRight", [0.1, 0.1], 0.5, false] call BIS_fnc_scaleAndTranslate;
	sleep (_t * 2);
	[_controlFront, 0.8, "topRight", [0.5, 0.3]] call BIS_fnc_scaleAndTranslate;
*/ Remove this after fill-in

bis_fnc_animatepicture.title: BIS_fnc_animatePicture
bis_fnc_animatepicture.description: Translates (relative or absolute), scales (relative or absolute), and sets the alpha over time on the provided control.

syntaxes.code: [control, durationOrSpeed, [translationPosition, isRelativeTranslation, useDuration], [scalePosition, isRelativeScale, scalePivot], alpha] call BIS_fnc_animatePicture

args.name: durationOrSpeed
args.desc: (Optional, default 2) transition duration or movement speed, depending on useDuration

args.name: isRelativeTranslation - Boolean - (Optional, default true) is translationPosition relative to the original control's position
useDuration
args.desc: (Optional, default true) if set to false, durationOrSpeed will be used as control speed (and effect duration will be recalculated from it)

args.name: scalePosition: Number or Array of Numbers - (Optional, default 1) define X and Y scale value
isRelativeScale
args.desc: (Optional, default true) is scalePosition relative to the original control's scale

bis_fnc_lookatarray.title: BIS_fnc_lookAtArray
bis_fnc_lookatarray.description: Executes a code when one of the specified objects is looked at (player's cursor pointed towards it) for enough time

args.name: initialize
args.desc: true to initialize, false to remove it

args.name:
lookAtData: Array - an array with arrays of look-up-data in form of:
*0: Object - Object to be looked at
*1: Number - How long player has to look at it
*2: Boolean - true to remove it from array when player looked at it
*3: Code - Code spawned when player looked long enough at the object

bis_fnc_lookatarrayeh.title: BIS_fnc_lookAtArrayEH
bis_fnc_lookatarrayeh.description: Event handler function for the BIS_fnc_lookAtArray function.

bis_fnc_animatedbriefing.title: BIS_fnc_animatedBriefing
bis_fnc_animatedbriefing.description: Plays the Animated Briefings. Basically, it is a wrap function for the BIS_fnc_eventTimeline function.

args.name:
timeline: Array - array in format [time, code]: 
* time: Number - time the code is executed
* code: Code - code executed when time is reached

args.desc: index of the event to play

args.name: markersHide
args.desc: (Optional, default `[]`) array of markers which should be hidden when briefing starts

args.name: markersShow
args.desc: (Optional, default  inline[]) array of markers which should be shown when the briefing is done

args.name: endPosition
args.desc: (Optional, default "") marker to focus when the briefing is done

args.name: codeEnd
args.desc: (Optional, default {}) code executed when briefing is done

bis_fnc_randomposintersection.title: BIS_fnc_randomPosIntersection
bis_fnc_randomposintersection.description: Returns random 2D position inside the intersection of two circles. [-1,-1] is returned if the circles do not intersect.

args.name:
firstCircle: Object, String or Array - first circle. Can be a trigger, a marker or an array in form 
*0: Array - circleCenter
**0: Number - coordinate X
**1: Number - coordinate Y
*1: Number - radius
secondCircle: Object, String or Array - second circle. Same as above.
positioning1
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) if a value between 0 and 1 is passed (0 and 1 included), then a gaussian distribution is used. This will influence the random position along the axis which connects the two circles' centers. A lower value means the position will be close to the first circle

args.name: positioning2
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) if a value between 0 and 1 is passed (0 and 1 included), then a gaussian distribution is used. This will influence the random position along the axis perpendicular to the axis which connects the two circles' centers

bis_fnc_boatrack01adjustzoffset.title: BIS_fnc_boatRack01AdjustZOffset
bis_fnc_boatrack01adjustzoffset.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is sub function for 'boat recovery' functionality.

	Execution:
	- Call from Init EH script that is added to object (boat rack) or from action code.

	Example:
		[_boatRack, _boat] call BIS_fnc_boatRack01AdjustZOffset;

	Required:
		Object (boat rack) must have vehicle in vehicle behavior configured (https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Vehicle_in_Vehicle_Transport).
		Object (boat rack) must have triggers set up with continuous actions.
		Object (boat rack) must have set of Z offset's predefined in cfgVehicles for know/supported boat types.

		Parameters used from cfgVehicles configuration:
		cargoBayAnimationSelection 		= "CargoBay_Move_Z";
		supportedVehicleOffsetsZ[]		= {{"C_Boat_Civil_01_F",0.55}};

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: boat rack object
		1: boat in cargo
		and
		other parameters from boat rack's cfgVehicles configuration.

	Returns: nothing
	Result: Adjusts the hight (Z offset) of boat rack suspension to prevent different boats clipping with visual mesh.

*/ Remove this after fill-in

	Required:
		Object (boat rack) must have vehicle in vehicle behavior configured (https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Vehicle_in_Vehicle_Transport).
		Object (boat rack) must have triggers set up with continuous actions.

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)

		and

bis_fnc_destroyer01animatehangardoors.title: BIS_fnc_destroyer01AnimateHangarDoors

/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is a sub function designed to handle animations of ship hangar doors. Used in Eden attributes and objects user actions.

	Execution:
	- Call from script.

	Example:
		[_shipPart, _value, false] spawn BIS_fnc_destroyer01AnimateHangarDoors;

	Required:
		Object (ship) must have all animations correctly defined and user actions configured.

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: ship-part object
		and
		1: animation state of doors
		2: animation speed (instant = true/smooth=false);

	Returns: nothing
	Result: Ship's hangar door animation is played with sounds added.

*/ Remove this after fill-in

bis_fnc_destroyer01handledamage.title: BIS_fnc_destroyer01HandleDamage
bis_fnc_destroyer01handledamage.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is a damage visual FX simulation function designed to animate ships bridge windows when shot.
	  Due to engine limitation (damage simulation is disabled for indestructible objects e.g. ships components) this workaround is applied.

	Execution:
	- Call from EH on the ship's model part with windows.

		Example:
		class Eventhandlers
		{
			HitPart = "_this call BIS_fnc_Destroyer01HandleDamage;";
		};

	Requirements:
	- Compatible object (e.g. ship component) must have a set of selections that are setup and named by convention.
	  Selections must be defined as hidden selections in order for setObjectTexture to work.

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: event Handler Array as documented here - https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers#HitPart

	Returns: nothing
	Result: Destroyer (ship) window textures are swapped for damaged ones. Simple swap.

*/ Remove this after fill-in

bis_fnc_destroyer01operatehangardoors.title: BIS_fnc_destroyer01OperateHangarDoors
bis_fnc_destroyer01operatehangardoors.description:
This function is designed to handle animations of ship hangar doors from vehicle user action (see ).
It calls BIS_fnc_destroyer01AnimateHangarDoors.

		Example:
